Text

Title : [The Blue Castle]325-the blue castle : a novel Author : [L. M. Montgomery]80-l. m. montgomery Release date : May 3 , 2022 [ eBook # 67979]Most recently updated : July 14 , 2023 Language : English Original publication : [United States]326-united states : [Frederick A. Stokes company]81-frederick a. stokes company , 1926 Credits : [Laura Natal Rodrigues]82-laura natal rodrigues ( Images generously made available by [Hathi Trust Digital Library]1-hathi trust digital library . )

If it had not rained on a certain May morning [Valancy Stirling]83-valancy ’s whole life would have been entirely different . [She]83-valancy would have gone , with [the rest of [[her]83-valancy clan]328-her clan]327-the rest of her clan , to [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s engagement picnic and [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent would have gone to [Montreal]2-montreal . But it did rain and [you]329-you shall hear what happened to [her]83-valancy because of it . [Valancy]83-valancy wakened early , in the lifeless , hopeless hour just preceding dawn . [She]83-valancy had not slept very well . [One]330-one does not sleep well , sometimes , when [one]330-one is twenty - nine on the morrow , and unmarried , in [a community and connection where [the unmarried]333-the unmarried]332-a community and connection where the unmarried are simply [those who have failed to get [a man]335-a man]334-those who have failed to get a man . [Deerwood]86-the stirlings and [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings had long since relegated [Valancy]83-valancy to hopeless old maidenhood . But [Valancy]83-valancy [herself]83-valancy had never quite relinquished a certain pitiful , shamed , little hope that Romance would come [her]83-valancy way yet — never , until this wet , horrible morning , when [she]83-valancy wakened to the fact that [she]83-valancy was twenty - nine and unsought by [any man]336-any man . Ay , therelay the sting . [Valancy]83-valancy did not mind so much being [an old maid]337-an old maid . After all , [she]83-valancy thought , being [an old maid]337-an old maid could n’t possibly be as dreadful as being married to [an Uncle Wellington]87-uncle wellington or [an Uncle Benjamin]339-an uncle benjamin , or even [an Uncle Herbert]340-an uncle herbert . What hurt [her]83-valancy was that [she]83-valancy had never had a chance to be anything but [an old maid]337-an old maid . [No man]342-no man had ever desired [her]83-valancy . The tears came into [her]83-valancy eyes as [she]83-valancy lay there alone in the faintly greying darkness . [She]83-valancy dared not let [herself]83-valancy cry as hard as [she]83-valancy wanted to , for two reasons . [She]83-valancy was afraid that crying might bring on another attack of that pain around the heart . [She]83-valancy had had a spell of it after [she]83-valancy had got into bed — rather worse than any [she]83-valancy had had yet . And [she]83-valancy was afraid [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother would notice [her]83-valancy red eyes at breakfast and keep at [her]83-valancy with minute , persistent , mosquito - like questions regarding the cause thereof . “ Suppose , ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy with a ghastly grin , “ [I]83-valancy answered with the plain truth , ‘ [I]83-valancy am crying because [I]83-valancy can not get married . ’ How horrified [Mother]88-mother would be — though [she]343-her mother is ashamed every day of [her]343-her mother life of [[her]343-her mother old maid daughter]2021-her old maid daughter . ”[83-valancy] But of course appearances should be kept up . “ It is not , ”[83-valancy] [Valancy]83-valancy could hear [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s prim , dictatorial voice asserting , “ it is notmaidenlyto think aboutmen . ”[343-her mother] The thought of [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s expression made [Valancy]83-valancy laugh — for [she]83-valancy had a sense of humour [nobody in [[her]83-valancy clan]328-her clan]346-nobody in her clan suspected . For that matter , there were a good many things about [Valancy]83-valancy that [nobody]348-nobody suspected . But [her]83-valancy laughter was very superficial and presently [she]83-valancy lay there , a huddled , futile little figure , listening to the rain pouring down outside and watching , with a sick distaste , the chill , merciless light creeping into [[her]83-valancy ugly , sordid room]349-her ugly , sordid room . [She]83-valancy knew the ugliness of [that room]350-that room by heart — knew it and hated it . The yellow - painted floor , with one hideous , “ hooked ”[83-valancy] rug by the bed , with a grotesque , “ hooked ”[83-valancy] dog on it , always grinning at [her]83-valancy when [she]83-valancy awoke ; the faded , dark - red paper ; the ceiling discoloured by old leaks and crossed by cracks ; the narrow , pinched little washstand ; the brown - paper lambrequin with purple roses on it ; the spotted old looking - glass with the crack across it , propped up on the inadequate dressing - table ; the jar of ancient potpourri made by [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother in [her]343-her mother mythical honeymoon ; the shell - covered box , with one burst corner , which [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had made in [her]343-her mother equally mythical girlhood ; the beaded pincushion with half its bead fringe gone ; the one stiff , yellow chair ; the faded old motto , “ Gone but not forgotten , ”[83-valancy] worked in coloured yarns about [Great - grand - mother [Stirling]83-valancy ’s grim old face]352-great - grand - mother stirling ’s grim old face ; the old photographs of [ancient relatives]353-ancient relatives long banished from [the rooms below]354-the rooms below . There were only two pictures that were not of [relatives]355-relatives . One , an old chromo of a puppy sitting on [a rainy doorstep]356-a rainy doorstep . That picture always made [Valancy]83-valancy unhappy . That forlorn little dog crouched on the doorstep in the driving rain ! Why didn’tsome oneopen the door and let [him]357-him in ? The other picture was a faded , passe - partouted engraving of [Queen Louise]90-queen louise coming down [a stairway]358-a stairway , which [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington had lavishly given [her]83-valancy on [her]83-valancy tenth birthday . For nineteen years [she]83-valancy had looked at it and hated it , beautiful , smug , self - satisfied [Queen Louise]90-queen louise . But [she]83-valancy never dared destroy it or remove it . [Mother]88-mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles would have been aghast , or , as [Valancy]83-valancy irreverently expressed it in [her]83-valancy thoughts , would have had a fit . [Every room in [the house]360-the house]359-every room in the house was ugly , of course . But [downstairs]361-downstairs appearances were kept up somewhat . There was no money for [[rooms]362-rooms [nobody]348-nobody ever saw]363-rooms nobody ever saw . [Valancy]83-valancy sometimes felt that [she]83-valancy could have done something for [[her]83-valancy room [herself]83-valancy]365-her room herself , even without money , if [she]83-valancy were permitted . But [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother had negatived every timid suggestion and [Valancy]83-valancy did not persist . [Valancy]83-valancy never persisted . [She]83-valancy was afraid to . [[Her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother could not brook opposition . [Mrs. Stirling]91-mrs. frederick would sulk for days if offended , with the airs of [an insulted duchess]368-an insulted duchess . The only thing [Valancy]83-valancy liked about [[her]83-valancy room]369-her room was that [she]83-valancy could be alone [there]370-there at night to cry if [she]83-valancy wanted to . But , after all , what did it matter if [a room , which [you]372-you used for nothing except sleeping and dressing in]371-a room , which you used for nothing except sleeping and dressing in , were ugly ? [Valancy]83-valancy was never permitted to stay alone in [[her]83-valancy room]369-her room for any other purpose . [People who wanted to be alone]374-people who wanted to be alone , so [Mrs. Frederick Stirling]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles believed , could only want to be alone for some sinister purpose . But [[her]83-valancy room in [the Blue Castle]3-the blue castle]375-her room in the blue castle was everything [a room]376-a room should be . [Valancy]83-valancy , so cowed and subdued and overridden and snubbed in real life , was wo nt to let [herself]83-valancy go rather splendidly in [her]83-valancy day - dreams . [Nobody in the Stirling clan]377-nobody in the stirling clan , or its ramifications , suspected this , least of all [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles . [They]379-they never knew that [Valancy]83-valancy had [two homes]380-two homes — [the ugly red brick box of [a home]382-a home]381-the ugly red brick box of a home , on [Elm Street]5-elm street , and [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle in [Spain]6-spain . [Valancy]83-valancy had lived spiritually in [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle ever since [she]83-valancy could remember . [She]83-valancy had been [a very tiny child]385-a very tiny child when [she]83-valancy found [herself]83-valancy possessed of it . Always , when [she]83-valancy shut [her]83-valancy eyes , [she]83-valancy could see [it]325-the blue castle plainly , with [its]325-the blue castle turrets and banners on the pine - clad mountain height , wrapped in its faint , blue loveliness , against the sunset skies of [a fair and unknown land]386-a fair and unknown land . Everything wonderful and beautiful was in [that castle]387-that castle . Jewels that [queens]388-queens might have worn ; robes of moonlight and fire ; couches of roses and gold ; long flights of shallow marble steps , with great , white urns , and with [slender , mist - clad maidens]389-slender , mist - clad maidens going up and down [them]390-them ; [courts]391-courts , marble - pillared , where [shimmering fountains fell and nightingales sang among the myrtles]392-shimmering fountains fell and nightingales sang among the myrtles ; [halls of mirrors]393-halls of mirrors that reflected only [handsome knights]394-handsome knights and [lovely women]395-lovely women — [herself]83-valancy [the loveliest of all , for whose glance [men]397-men]396-the loveliest of all , for whose glance men died . All that supported [her]83-valancy through the boredom of [her]83-valancy days was the hope of going on a dream spree at night . Most , if not all , of [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings would have died of horror if [they]398-they had known half the things [Valancy]83-valancy did in [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle . For one thing [she]83-valancy had quite [a few lovers]400-a few lovers in [it]399-her blue castle . Oh , only one at a time . [One who wooed [her]83-valancy with all the romantic ardour of the age of chivalry and won [her]83-valancy after long devotion and many deeds of derring - do]401-one who wooed her with all the romantic ardour of the age of chivalry and won her after long devotion and many deeds of derring - do , and was wedded to [her]83-valancy with pomp and circumstance in [the great , banner - hung chapel of [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle]402-the great , banner - hung chapel of the blue castle . At twelve , [this lover]404-this lover was [a fair lad with golden curls and heavenly blue eyes]405-a fair lad with golden curls and heavenly blue eyes . At fifteen , [he]404-this lover was tall and dark and pale , but still necessarily handsome . At twenty , [he]404-this lover was ascetic , dreamy , spiritual . At twenty - five , [he]404-this lover had a clean - cut jaw , slightly grim , and a face strong and rugged rather than handsome . [Valancy]83-valancy never grew older than twenty - five in [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle , but recently — very recently — [[her]83-valancy hero]407-her hero had had reddish , tawny hair , a twisted smile and a mysterious past . [I]0-i do n’t say [Valancy]83-valancy deliberately murdered [these lovers]408-these lovers as [she]83-valancy outgrew [them]408-these lovers . [One]330-one simply faded away as another came . Things are very convenient in this respect in [Blue Castles]410-blue castles . But , on this morning of [her]83-valancy day of fate , [Valancy]83-valancy could not find the key of [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle . [Reality]92-reality pressed on [her]83-valancy too hardly , barking at [her]83-valancy heels like a maddening little dog . [She]83-valancy was twenty - nine , lonely , undesired , ill - favoured — [the only homely girl in [a handsome clan , with no past and no future]413-a handsome clan , with no past and no future]412-the only homely girl in a handsome clan , with no past and no future . As far as [she]83-valancy could look back , life was drab and colourless , with not one single crimson or purple spot anywhere . As far as [she]83-valancy could look forward it seemed certain to be just the same until [she]83-valancy was nothing but a solitary , little withered leaf clinging to a wintry bough . The moment when [a woman]414-a woman realises that [she]414-a woman has nothing to live for — neither love , duty , purpose nor hope — holds for [her]414-a woman the bitterness of death . “ And [I]83-valancy just have to go on living because [I]83-valancy ca n’t stop . [I]83-valancy may have to live eighty years , ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy , in a kind of panic . “ [We]2022-we ’re all horribly long - lived . It sickens [me]83-valancy to think of it . ”[83-valancy] [She]83-valancy was glad it was raining — or rather , [she]83-valancy was drearily satisfied that it was raining . There would be no picnic that day . This annual picnic , whereby [Aunt]415-aunt and [Uncle Wellington]87-uncle wellington — [one]330-one always thought of [them]417-them in that succession — inevitably celebrated [their]417-them engagement at a picnic thirty years before , had been , of late years , a veritable nightmare to [Valancy]83-valancy . By an impish coincidence it was the same day as [her]83-valancy birthday and , after [she]83-valancy had passed twenty - five , [nobody]348-nobody let [her]83-valancy forget it . Much as [she]83-valancy hated going to the picnic , it would never have occurred to [her]83-valancy to rebel against it . There seemed to be nothing of the revolutionary in [her]83-valancy nature . And [she]83-valancy knew exactly what [every one]419-every one would say to [her]83-valancy at the picnic . [Uncle Wellington]87-uncle wellington , whom [she]83-valancy disliked and despised even though [he]87-uncle wellington had fulfilled the highest Stirling aspiration , “ marrying money , ”[87-uncle wellington] would say to [her]83-valancy in a pig ’s whisper , “ Not thinking of getting married yet , [[my]87-uncle wellington dear]2023-my dear ? ”[87-uncle wellington] and then go off into the bellow of laughter with which [he]87-uncle wellington invariably concluded [his]87-uncle wellington dull remarks . [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington , of whom [Valancy]83-valancy stood in abject awe , would tell [her]83-valancy about [Olive]93-olive ’s new chiffon dress and [Cecil]94-cecil ’s last devoted letter . [Valancy]83-valancy would have to look as pleased and interested as if the dress and letter had been [hers]83-valancy or else [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington would be offended . [And Valancy]83-valancy had long ago decided that [she]83-valancy would rather offend [God]95-god than [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington , because [God]95-god might forgive [her]83-valancy but [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington never would . [Aunt Alberta]96-aunt alberta , enormously fat , with an amiable habit of always referring to [[her]96-aunt alberta husband]420-her husband as “ [he]420-her husband , ”[420-her husband] as if [he]420-her husband were [the only male creature in [the world]422-the world , who could never forget that [she]96-aunt alberta had been a great beauty in [her]96-aunt alberta youth]421-the only male creature in the world , who could never forget that she had been a great beauty in her youth , would condole with [Valancy]83-valancy on [her]96-aunt alberta sallow skin — “ [I]83-valancy do n’t know why [all the girls of today]2024-all the girls of today are so sunburned . WhenIwas [a girl]2025-a girl [my]83-valancy skin was roses and cream . [I]83-valancy was counted [the prettiest girl in [Canada]7-canada]2026-the prettiest girl in canada , [[my]83-valancy dear]2023-my dear . ”[83-valancy] Perhaps [Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert would n’t say anything — or perhaps [he]97-uncle herbert would remark jocularly , “ How fat [you]83-valancy ’re getting , [Doss]98-doss ! ”[97-uncle herbert] And then [everybody]423-everybody would laugh over the excessively humorous idea of poor , scrawny little [Doss]98-doss getting fat . [Handsome , solemn Uncle James]99-uncle james , whom [Valancy]83-valancy disliked but respected because [he]99-uncle james was reputed to be very clever and was therefore [the clan oracle]424-the clan oracle — brains being none too plentiful in the [Stirling]83-valancy connection — would probably remark with the owl - like sarcasm that had won [him]99-uncle james [his]99-uncle james reputation , “ [I]100-uncle benjamin suppose [you]83-valancy ’re busy with [your]83-valancy hope - chest these days ? ”[100-uncle benjamin] And [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin would ask some of [his]100-uncle benjamin abominable conundrums , between wheezy chuckles , and answer them [himself]100-uncle benjamin . “ What is the difference between [Doss]98-doss and a mouse ? “[100-uncle benjamin] The mouse wishes to harm the cheese and [Doss]98-doss wishes to charm the [he]425-he ’s . ” [Valancy]83-valancy had heard [him]100-uncle benjamin ask that riddle fifty times and every time [she]83-valancy wanted to throw something at [him]100-uncle benjamin . But [she]83-valancy never did . In the first place , [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings simply did not throw things ; in the second place , [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin was [a wealthy and childless old widower]2028-a wealthy and childless old widower and [Valancy]83-valancy had been brought up in the fear and admonition of [his]100-uncle benjamin money . If [she]83-valancy offended [him]100-uncle benjamin [he]100-uncle benjamin would cut [her]83-valancy out of [his]100-uncle benjamin will — supposing [she]83-valancy were in it . [Valancy]83-valancy did not want to be cut out of [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin ’s will . [She]83-valancy had been poor all [her]83-valancy life and knew the galling bitterness of it . So [she]83-valancy endured [his]100-uncle benjamin riddles and even smiled tortured little smiles over them . [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel , downright and disagreeable as an east wind , would criticise [her]83-valancy in some way — [Valancy]83-valancy could not predict just how , for [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel never repeated a criticism — [she]101-aunt isabel found something new with which to jab [you]2029-you every time . [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel prided [herself]101-aunt isabel on saying what [she]101-aunt isabel thought , but did n’t like it so well when [other people]2030-other people said whattheythought toher . [Valancy]83-valancy never said whatshethought . [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana — named after [[her]102-cousin georgiana great - great - grand - mother]2031-her great - great - grand - mother , who had been named after [George the Fourth]103-george the fourth — would recount dolorously the names of all [relatives]355-relatives and [friends who had died since the last picnic]2033-friends who had died since the last picnic and wonder “[98-doss] which of [us]426-us will be the first to go next . ” Oppressively competent , [Aunt Mildred]104-aunt mildred would talk endlessly of [[her]104-aunt mildred husband]420-her husband and [her]104-aunt mildred odious prodigies of [babies]2035-babies to [Valancy]83-valancy , because [Valancy]83-valancy would be the only one [she]104-aunt mildred could find to put up with it . For the same reason , [Cousin Gladys]105-cousin gladys — really [First Cousin Gladys]105-cousin gladys once removed , according to the strict way in which [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings tabulated relationship — [a tall , thin lady who admitted [she]2036-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition had a sensitive disposition]2036-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition , would describe minutely the tortures of [her]2036-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition neuritis . And [Olive]93-olive , [the wonder girl of [the whole Stirling clan]2038-the whole stirling clan]2037-the wonder girl of the whole stirling clan , who had everything [Valancy]83-valancy had not — beauty , popularity , love,—would show off [her]93-olive beauty and presume on [her]93-olive popularity and flaunt [her]93-olive diamond insignia of love in [Valancy]83-valancy ’s dazzled , envious eyes . There would be none of all this today . And there would be no packing up of teaspoons . The packing up was always left for [Valancy]83-valancy and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles . And once , six years ago , a silver teaspoon from [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s wedding set had been lost . [Valancy]83-valancy never heard the last of that silver teaspoon . [Its]2039-its ghost appeared Banquo - like at every subsequent family feast . Oh , yes , [Valancy]83-valancy knew exactly what the picnic would be like and [she]83-valancy blessed the rain that had saved [her]83-valancy from it . There would be no picnic this year . If [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington could not celebrate on the sacred day itself [she]84-aunt wellington would have no celebration at all . Thank whatever gods there were for that . Since there would be no picnic , [Valancy]83-valancy made up [her]83-valancy mind that , if the rain held up in the afternoon , [she]83-valancy would go up to [the library]2040-the library and get another of [John Foster]106-john foster ’s books . [Valancy]83-valancy was never allowed to read novels , but [John Foster]106-john foster ’s books were not novels . They were “[98-doss] nature books”—so [the librarian]2041-the librarian told [Mrs. Frederick Stirling—“all]107-mrs. frederick stirling—“all[98-doss] about [the woods]427-the woods and birds and bugs and things like that , [you]428-your know . ” So [Valancy]83-valancy was allowed to read them — under protest , for it was only too evident that [she]83-valancy enjoyed them too much . It was permissible , even laudable , to read to improve [your]428-your mind and [your]428-your religion , but a book that was enjoyable was dangerous . [Valancy]83-valancy did not know whether [her]83-valancy mind was being improved or not ; but [she]83-valancy felt vaguely that if [she]83-valancy had come across [John Foster]106-john foster ’s books years ago life might have been a different thing for [her]83-valancy . They seemed to [her]83-valancy to yield glimpses of a world into which [she]83-valancy might once have entered , though the door was forever barred to [her]83-valancy now . It was only within the last year that [John Foster]106-john foster ’s books had been in [the Deerwood library]2042-the deerwood library , though [the librarian]2041-the librarian told [Valancy]83-valancy that [he]429-he had been [a well - known writer]2044-a well - known writer for several years . “[98-doss] Where does [he]429-he live ? ” [Valancy]83-valancy had asked . “[348-nobody] [Nobody]348-nobody knows . From [his]429-he books [he]429-he must be [a Canadian]431-a canadian , but no more information can be had . [[His]429-he publishers]432-his publishers wo n’t say a word . Quite likely [John Foster]106-john foster is a nom de plume . [His]429-he books are so popular [we]433-we ca n’t keep them in at all , though [I]0-i really ca n’t see what [people]434-people find in them to rave over . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think they ’re wonderful , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy , timidly . “[0-i] Oh — well — ” [Miss Clarkson]108-miss clarkson smiled in a patronising fashion that relegated [Valancy]83-valancy ’s opinions to limbo , “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t say [I]0-i care much for bugs [myself]0-i . But certainly [Foster]106-john foster seems to know all there is to know about them . ” [Valancy]83-valancy did n’t know whether [she]83-valancy cared much for bugs either . It was not [John Foster]106-john foster ’s uncanny knowledge of wild creatures and insect life that enthralled [her]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy could hardly say what it was — some tantalising lure of a mystery never revealed — some hint of a great secret just a little further on — some faint , elusive echo of lovely , forgotten things — [John Foster]106-john foster ’s magic was indefinable . Yes , [she]83-valancy would get a new Foster book . It was a month since [she]83-valancy hadThistle [Harvest]109-harvest , so surely [Mother]88-mother could not object . [Valancy]83-valancy had read it four times — [she]83-valancy knew whole passages off by heart . And — [she]83-valancy almost thought [she]83-valancy would go and see [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent about that queer pain around the heart . It had come rather often lately , and the palpitations were becoming annoying , not to speak of an occasional dizzy moment and a queer shortness of breath . But could [she]83-valancy go to see [him]85-dr. trent without telling [any one]2045-any one ? It was a most daring thought . [None of [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings]2046-none of the stirlings ever consulted [a doctor]2047-a doctor without holding [a family council]2048-a family council and getting [Uncle James]99-uncle james ’ approval . Then , [they]2046-none of the stirlings went to [Dr. Ambrose Marsh of Port Lawrence]110-dr. marsh , who had married [Second Cousin Adelaide Stirling]111-second cousin adelaide stirling . There would be such a fuss made and [every member of [the family]2052-the family]2051-every member of the family would come down and talk it over and advise [her]83-valancy and caution [her]83-valancy and warn [her]83-valancy and tell [her]83-valancy horrible tales of [great - aunts]2053-great - aunts and [cousins forty times removed who had been “[106-john foster] just like that ” and “[106-john foster] dropped dead without a moment ’s warning]2054-cousins forty times removed who had been “ just like that ” and “ dropped dead without a moment ’s warning , [[my]0-i dear]2023-my dear . ” [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel would remember that [she]101-aunt isabel had always said [Doss]98-doss looked like [a girl who would have heart trouble—“so[106-john foster] pinched and peaked always ”]2055-a girl who would have heart trouble—“so pinched and peaked always ” ; and [Uncle Wellington]87-uncle wellington would take it as a personal insult , when “[83-valancy] no [Stirling]83-valancy ever had heart disease before ” ; and [Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana would forebode in perfectly audible asides that “[436-poor , dear little doss] [poor , dear little Doss]436-poor , dear little doss is n’t long for [this world]437-this world , [I]0-i ’m afraid ” ; and [Cousin Gladys]105-cousin gladys would say , “[0-i] Why , [myheart]438-myheart has been like that foryears , ” in a tone that implied [no one else had any business even to have a heart]2056-no one else had any business even to have a heart ; and [Olive]93-olive — [Olive]93-olive would merely look beautiful and superior and disgustingly healthy , as if to say , “[438-myheart] Why all this fuss over a faded superfluity like [Doss]98-doss when [you]439-you haveme ? ” [Valancy]83-valancy felt that [she]83-valancy could n’t tell [anybody]2057-anybody unless [she]83-valancy had to . [She]83-valancy felt quite sure there was nothing at all seriously wrong with [her]83-valancy heart and no need of all the pother that would ensue if [she]83-valancy mentioned it . [She]83-valancy would just slip up quietly and see [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent that very day . As for [his]85-dr. trent bill , [she]83-valancy had the two hundred dollars that [[her]83-valancy father]2058-her father had put in the bank for [her]83-valancy the day [she]83-valancy was born . [She]83-valancy was never allowed to use even the interest of this , but [she]83-valancy would secretly take out enough to pay [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent was [a gruff , outspoken , absent - minded old fellow]2059-a gruff , outspoken , absent - minded old fellow , but [he]85-dr. trent was a recognised authority on heart disease , even if [he]85-dr. trent were only [a general practitioner in out - of - the - world]2060-a general practitioner in out - of - the - world [Deerwood]10-deerwood . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent was over seventy and there had been rumours that [he]85-dr. trent meant to retire soon . [None of [the Stirling clan]2062-the stirling clan]2061-none of the stirling clan had ever gone to [him]85-dr. trent since [he]85-dr. trent had told [Cousin Gladys]105-cousin gladys , ten years before , that [her]105-cousin gladys neuritis was all imaginary and that [she]105-cousin gladys enjoyed it . [You]2063-you could n’t patronise [a doctor who insulted [[your]2063-you first - cousin]2065-your first - cousin - once - removed like that — not to mention that [he]85-dr. trent was [a Presbyterian]2066-a presbyterian when all [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings went to [the Anglican church]2067-the anglican church]2064-a doctor who insulted your first - cousin - once - removed like that — not to mention that he was a presbyterian when all the stirlings went to the anglican church . But [Valancy]83-valancy , between the devil of disloyalty to [clan and the deep sea of fuss and clatter and advice]2068-clan and the deep sea of fuss and clatter and advice , thought [she]83-valancy would take a chance with [the devil]2069-the devil .[98-doss]

When [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles knocked at [her]440-her door , [Valancy]83-valancy knew it was half - past seven and [she]83-valancy must get up . As long as [she]83-valancy could remember , [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had knocked at [her]440-her door at half - past seven . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles and [Mrs. Frederick Stirling]91-mrs. frederick had been up since seven , but [Valancy]83-valancy was allowed to lie abed half an hour longer because of a family tradition that [she]83-valancy was delicate . [Valancy]83-valancy got up , though [she]83-valancy hated getting up more this morning than ever [she]83-valancy had before . What was there to get up for ? Another dreary day like all the days that had preceded it , full of meaningless little tasks , joyless and unimportant , that benefited [nobody]348-nobody . But if [she]83-valancy did not get up at once [she]83-valancy would not be ready for breakfast at eight o’clock . Hard and fast times for meals were the rule in [[Mrs. Stirling]91-mrs. frederick ’s household]442-mrs. stirling ’s household . Breakfast at eight , dinner at one , supper at six , year in and year out . No excuses for being late were ever tolerated . So up [Valancy]83-valancy got , shivering . [The room]443-the room was bitterly cold with the raw , penetrating chill of a wet May morning . [The house]360-the house would be cold all day . It was one of [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick ’s rules that no fires were necessary after the twenty - fourth of May . Meals were cooked on the little oil - stove in [the back porch]445-the back porch . And though May might be icy and October frost - bitten , no fires were lighted until the twenty - first of October by the calendar . On the twenty - first of October [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick began cooking over the [kitchen range]446-kitchen range and lighted a fire in the sitting - room stove in the evenings . It was whispered about in the connection that the late [Frederick Stirling]91-mrs. frederick had caught the cold which resulted in [his]447-his death during [Valancy]83-valancy ’s first year of life because [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick would not have a fire on the twentieth of October . [She]83-valancy lighted it the next day — but that was a day too late for [Frederick Stirling]91-mrs. frederick . [Valancy]83-valancy took off and hung up in [the closet]448-the closet [her]83-valancy nightdress of coarse , unbleached cotton , with high neck and long , tight sleeves . [She]83-valancy put on undergarments of a similar nature , a dress of brown gingham , thick , black stockings and rubber - heeled boots . Of late years [she]83-valancy had fallen into the habit of doing [her]83-valancy hair with the shade of the window by the looking - glass pulled down . The lines on [her]83-valancy face did not show so plainly then . But this morning [she]83-valancy jerked the shade to the very top and looked at [herself]83-valancy in the leprous mirror with a passionate determination to see [herself]83-valancy as [the world]422-the world saw [her]83-valancy . The result was rather dreadful . [Even a beauty]450-even a beauty would have found that harsh , unsoftened side - light trying . [Valancy]83-valancy saw straight black hair , short and thin , always lustreless despite the fact that [she]83-valancy gave [it]451-it one hundred strokes of the brush , neither more nor less , every night of [her]83-valancy life and faithfully rubbed [Redfern]112-dr. redfern ’s Hair Vigor into the roots , more lustreless than ever in its morning roughness ; fine , straight , black brows ; a nose [she]83-valancy had always felt was much too small even for [her]83-valancy small , three - cornered , white face ; a small , pale mouth that always fell open a trifle over little , pointed white teeth ; a figure thin and flat - breasted , rather below the average height . [She]83-valancy had somehow escaped the family high cheek - bones , and [her]83-valancy dark - brown eyes , too soft and shadowy to be black , had a slant that was almost Oriental . Apart from [her]83-valancy eyes [she]83-valancy was neither pretty nor ugly — just insignificant - looking , [she]83-valancy concluded bitterly . How plain the lines around [her]83-valancy eyes and mouth were in that merciless light ! And never had [her]83-valancy narrow , white face looked so narrow and so white . [She]83-valancy did [her]83-valancy hair in a pompadour . Pompadours had long gone out of fashion , but [they]452-they had been in when [Valancy]83-valancy first put [her]83-valancy hair up and [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington had decided that [she]83-valancy must always wear [her]83-valancy hair so . “ It is theonlyway that becomes [you]2070-you . [Your]2070-you face is so small that youmustadd height to it by a pompadour effect , ”[84-aunt wellington] said [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington , who always enunciated commonplaces as if uttering profound and important truths . [Valancy]83-valancy had hankered to do [her]83-valancy hair pulled low on [her]83-valancy forehead , with puffs above the ears , as [Olive]93-olive was wearing [hers]93-olive . But [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s dictum had such an effect on [her]83-valancy that [she]83-valancy never dared change [her]83-valancy style of hairdressing again . But then , there were so many things [Valancy]83-valancy never dared do . All [her]83-valancy life [she]83-valancy had been afraid of something , [she]83-valancy thought bitterly . From the very dawn of recollection , when [she]83-valancy had been so horribly afraid of the big black bear that lived , so [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles told [her]83-valancy , in [the closet under the stairs]453-the closet under the stairs . “ And [I]89-cousin stickles always will be — [I]89-cousin stickles know it — [I]89-cousin stickles ca n’t help it . [I]89-cousin stickles do n’t know what it would be like not to be afraid of something . ”[89-cousin stickles] Afraid of [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s sulky fits — afraid of offending [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin — afraid of becoming a target for [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s contempt — afraid of [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel ’s biting comments — afraid of [Uncle James]99-uncle james ’ disapproval — afraid of offending [the whole clan]455-the whole clan ’s opinions and prejudices — afraid of not keeping up appearances — afraid to say what [she]83-valancy really thought of anything — afraid of poverty in [her]83-valancy old age . Fear — fear — fear — [she]83-valancy could never escape from it . It bound [her]83-valancy and enmeshed [her]83-valancy like a spider ’s web of steel . Only in [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle could [she]83-valancy find temporary release . And this morning [Valancy]83-valancy could not believe [she]83-valancy had a Blue Castle . [She]83-valancy would never be able to find it again . [Twenty - nine , unmarried , undesired]457-twenty - nine , unmarried , undesired — what had [she]83-valancy to do with [the fairy - like chatelaine of [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle]458-the fairy - like chatelaine of the blue castle ? [She]83-valancy would cut such childish nonsense out of [her]83-valancy life forever and face reality unflinchingly . [She]83-valancy turned from [her]83-valancy unfriendly mirror and looked out . The ugliness of the view always struck [her]83-valancy like a blow ; the ragged fence , [the tumble - down old carriage - shop in [the next lot]461-the next lot]460-the tumble - down old carriage - shop in the next lot , plastered with crude , violently coloured advertisements ; [the grimy railway station]462-the grimy railway station beyond , with the awful derelicts that were always hanging around [it]462-the grimy railway station even at this early hour . In the pouring rain everything looked worse than usual , especially the beastly advertisement , “ Keep that schoolgirl complexion . ”[83-valancy] Valancyhadkept [her]83-valancy schoolgirl complexion . That was just the trouble . There was not a gleam of beauty anywhere—“exactly like [my]83-valancy life , ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy drearily . [Her]83-valancy brief bitterness had passed . [She]83-valancy accepted facts as resignedly as [she]83-valancy had always accepted them . [She]83-valancy was one of [the people whom life always passes by]463-the people whom life always passes by . There was no altering that fact . In this mood [Valancy]83-valancy went down to breakfast .

Breakfast was always the same . Oatmeal porridge , which [Valancy]83-valancy loathed , toast and tea , and one teaspoonful of marmalade . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick thought two teaspoonfuls extravagant — but that did not matter to [Valancy]83-valancy , who hated marmalade , too . [The chilly , gloomy little dining - room]464-the chilly , gloomy little dining - room was chillier and gloomier than usual ; the rain streamed down outside the window ; departed Stirlings , in atrocious , gilt frames , wider than the pictures , glowered down from the walls . And yet [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles wished [Valancy]83-valancy many happy returns of the day ! “ Sit up straight , [Doss]98-doss , ”[343-her mother] was all [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother said . [Valancy]83-valancy sat up straight . [She]83-valancy talked to [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles of the things [they]467-they always talked of . [She]83-valancy never wondered what would happen if [she]83-valancy tried to talk of something else . [She]83-valancy knew . Therefore [she]83-valancy never did it . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick was offended with [Providence]113-providence for sending a rainy day when [she]91-mrs. frederick wanted to go to a picnic , so [she]91-mrs. frederick ate [her]91-mrs. frederick breakfast in a sulky silence for which [Valancy]83-valancy was rather grateful . But [Christine Stickles]114-christine stickles whined endlessly on as usual , complaining about everything — the weather , the leak in the pantry , the price of oatmeal and butter — [Valancy]83-valancy felt at once [she]83-valancy had buttered [her]83-valancy toast too lavishly — the epidemic of mumps in [Deerwood]10-deerwood . “ [Doss]98-doss will be sure to ketch [them]469-them , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy foreboded . “ [Doss]98-doss must not go where [she]98-doss is likely to catch mumps , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick shortly . [Valancy]83-valancy had never had mumps — or whooping cough — or chicken - pox — or measles — or anything [she]83-valancy should have had — nothing but horrible colds every winter . [Doss]98-doss ’ winter colds were a sort of tradition in [the family]2052-the family . Nothing , it seemed , could prevent [her]83-valancy from catching [them]469-them . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles did [their]470-their heroic best . One winter [they]470-their kept [Valancy]83-valancy housed up from November to May , in [the warm sitting - room]471-the warm sitting - room . [She]83-valancy was not even allowed to go to [church]472-church . And [Valancy]83-valancy took cold after cold and ended up with bronchitis in June . “ None ofmyfamily were ever like that , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick , implying that it must be a [Stirling]83-valancy tendency . “ [The Stirlings]86-the stirlings seldom take colds , ”[89-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles resentfully . [Shehad]83-valancy been [a Stirling]473-a stirling . “ [I]91-mrs. frederick think , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick , “ that if [a person]2071-a person makes up [her]2071-a person mindnotto have colds [she]2071-a person will nothavecolds . ”[91-mrs. frederick] So that was the trouble . It was all [Valancy]83-valancy ’s own fault . But on this particular morning [Valancy]83-valancy ’s unbearable grievance was that [she]83-valancy was called [Doss]98-doss . [She]83-valancy had endured it for twenty - nine years , and all at once [she]83-valancy felt [she]83-valancy could not endure it any longer . [Her]83-valancy full name was [Valancy Jane]83-valancy . [Valancy Jane]83-valancy was rather terrible , but [she]83-valancy liked [Valancy]83-valancy , with [its]83-valancy odd , out - land tang . But [Valancy]83-valancy must be at work and fancy work materials were too expensive . Idleness was a cardinal sin in [the Stirling household]489-the stirling household . When [Valancy]83-valancy had been [a child]490-a child [she]83-valancy had been made to write down every night , in a small , hated , black notebook , all the minutes [she]83-valancy had spent in idleness that day . [She]83-valancy went to [[her]83-valancy room]369-her room to get a better thimble and [she]83-valancy openedThistle Harvestguiltily at random . “ [The woods]427-the woods are so human , ”[106-john foster] wrote [John Foster]106-john foster , “ that to know [them]427-the woods one must live with [them]427-the woods . An occasional saunter through [them]427-the woods , keeping to the well - trodden paths , will never admit [us]2076-we to [their]427-the woods intimacy . If [we]2076-we wish to be [friends]2077-friends [we]2076-we must seek [them]427-the woods out and win [them]427-the woods by frequent , reverent visits at all hours ; by morning , by noon , and by night ; and at all seasons , in spring , in summer , in autumn , in winter . Otherwise [we]2076-we can never really know [them]427-the woods and any pretence [we]2076-we may make to the contrary will never impose on [them]427-the woods . [They]427-the woods have [their]427-the woods own effective way of keeping [aliens]2078-aliens at a distance and shutting [their]427-the woods hearts to [mere casual sightseers]2079-mere casual sightseers . It is of no use to seek [the woods]427-the woods from any motive except sheer love of [them]427-the woods ; [they]427-the woods will find [us]2076-we out at once and hide all [their]427-the woods sweet , old - world secrets from [us]2076-we . But if [they]427-the woods know [we]2076-we come to [them]427-the woods because [we]2076-we love [them]427-the woods [they]427-the woods will be very kind to [us]2076-we and give [us]2076-we such treasures of beauty and delight as are not bought or sold in any market - place . For [the woods]427-the woods , when [they]427-the woods give at all , give unstintedly and hold nothing back from [[their]427-the woods true worshippers]2082-their true worshippers . [We]2076-we must go to [them]427-the woods lovingly , humbly , patiently , watchfully , and [we]2076-we shall learn what poignant loveliness lurks in [the wild places]2083-the wild places and silent intervals , lying under starshine and sunset , what cadences of unearthly music are harped on aged pine boughs or crooned in [copses of fir]2084-copses of fir , what delicate savours exhale from mosses and ferns in sunny corners or on [damp brooklands]2085-damp brooklands , what dreams and myths and legends of an older time haunt [them]427-the woods . Then the immortal heart of [the woods]427-the woods will beat against [ours]2076-we and its subtle life will steal into [our]2076-we veins and make [us]2076-we its own forever , so that no matter where [we]2076-we go or how widely [we]2076-we wander [we]2076-we shall yet be drawn back to [the forest]2087-the forest to find [our]2076-we most enduring kinship . ”[106-john foster] “ [Doss]98-doss , ”[343-her mother] called [[her]494-her mother]343-her mother from [the hall below]496-the hall below , “ what are [you]98-doss doing all by [yourself]98-doss in [that room]350-that room ? ”[343-her mother] [Valancy]83-valancy droppedThistle Harvestlike a hot coal and fled [downstairs]361-downstairs to [[her]83-valancy patches]498-her patches ; but [she]83-valancy felt the strange exhilaration of spirit that always came momentarily to [her]83-valancy when [she]83-valancy dipped into one of [John Foster]106-john foster ’s books . [This strange man with the blue glasses]2121-this strange man with the blue glasses could n’t mean [her]83-valancy . The ordeal was not so dreadful , after all . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent was as gruff and abrupt as usual , but [he]85-dr. trent did not tell [her]565-her ailment was imaginary . [Valancy]83-valancy was just in time for supper . The sun had clouded over , and a dismal , drizzling rain was falling again . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had the neuralgia . There was a rosebush on [the little Stirling lawn]634-the little stirling lawn , growing beside the gate . It was called “ Doss ’s rosebush . ”[102-cousin georgiana] [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana had given it to [Valancy]83-valancy five years ago and [Valancy]83-valancy had planted it joyfully . [She]83-valancy loved roses . But — of course — the rosebush never bloomed . That was [her]83-valancy luck . [Valancy]83-valancy did everything [she]83-valancy could think of and took the advice of [everybody in the clan]635-everybody in the clan , but still the rosebush would not bloom . It throve and grew luxuriantly , with great leafy branches untouched of rust or spider ; but not even a bud had ever appeared on it . [Valancy]83-valancy , looking at it two days after [her]83-valancy birthday , was filled with a sudden , overwhelming hatred for it . The thing would n’t bloom : very well , then , [she]83-valancy would cut it down . [She]83-valancy marched to [the tool - room in [the barn]637-the barn]636-the tool - room in the barn for [her]83-valancy garden knife and [she]83-valancy went at the rosebush viciously . Half of them were already strewn on the walk . The bush looked sadly dismantled . “ [Doss]98-doss , what on earth are [you]98-doss doing ? Have [you]98-doss gone crazy ? ”[83-valancy] “ No , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy meant to say it defiantly , but habit was too strong for [her]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy said it deprecatingly . “ [I]83-valancy — [I]83-valancy just made up [my]83-valancy mind to cut this bush down . It is no good . It never blooms — never will bloom . ”[83-valancy] “ That is no reason for destroying it , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick sternly . “ It was a beautiful bush and quite ornamental . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick turned without a word and marched back into [the house]360-the house . The mischief was done now . [Valancy]83-valancy knew [she]83-valancy had offended [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother deeply and would not be spoken to or noticed in any way for two or three days . [Valancy]83-valancy sighed and put away [her]83-valancy garden knife , hanging it precisely on its precise nail in the tool - shop . [She]83-valancy cleared away the severed branches and swept up the leaves . [Her]83-valancy lips twitched as [she]83-valancy looked at the straggling bush . But [she]83-valancy did not feel repentant — only sorry [she]83-valancy had offended [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother . Things would be so uncomfortable until [she]83-valancy was forgiven . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick was one of [those women who can make [their]646-those women who can make their anger felt all over a house anger felt all over [a house]647-a house]646-those women who can make their anger felt all over a house . Walls and doors are no protection from it . “ [You]83-valancy ’d better go [uptown]502-uptown and git the mail , ”[89-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles , when [Valancy]83-valancy went in . “ Ican’t go — [I]89-cousin stickles feel all sorter peaky and piny this spring . [[Her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother did not have a box . [They]651-they got too little mail to bother with it . [Valancy]83-valancy did not expect any mail , except theChristian Times , which was the only paper [they]651-they took . [They]651-they hardly ever got any letters . But [Valancy]83-valancy rather liked to stand in [the office]581-the office and watch [Mr. Carewe]139-mr. carewe , [the grey - bearded , Santa - Clausy old clerk]653-the grey - bearded , santa - clausy old clerk , handing out letters to [the lucky people who did get them]654-the lucky people who did get them . [He]139-mr. carewe did it with such a detached , impersonal , Jove - like air , as if it did not matter in the least to [him]139-mr. carewe what supernal joys or shattering horrors might be in those letters for [the people to whom [they]656-they were addressed]655-the people to whom they were addressed . Letters had a fascination for [Valancy]83-valancy , perhaps because [she]83-valancy so seldom got any . In [her]83-valancy Blue Castle exciting epistles , bound with silk and sealed with crimson , were always being brought to [her]83-valancy by pages in livery of gold and blue , but in real life [her]83-valancy only letters were occasional perfunctory notes from [relatives]355-relatives or an advertising circular . Consequently [she]83-valancy was immensely surprised when [Mr. Carewe]139-mr. carewe , looking even more Jovian than usual , poked a letter out to [her]83-valancy . Yes , it was addressed to [her]83-valancy plainly , in a fierce , black hand : “ [Miss Valancy Stirling]83-valancy , [Elm Street]5-elm street , [Deerwood”—and]20-deerwood”—and[139-mr. carewe] the postmark was [Montreal]2-montreal . [Valancy]83-valancy picked it up with a little quickening of [her]83-valancy breath . [Montreal]2-montreal ! It must be from [Doctor Trent]140-doctor trent . [He]140-doctor trent had remembered [her]83-valancy , after all . [Valancy]83-valancy met [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin coming in as [she]83-valancy was going out and was glad the letter was safely in [her]83-valancy bag . “ What , ”[100-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin , “ is the difference between a donkey and a postage - stamp ? ”[100-uncle benjamin] “ [I]83-valancy do n’t know . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles pounced on [theTimeswhen Valancy]83-valancy got [home]2135-home , but it did not occur to [her]83-valancy to ask if there were any letters . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick would have asked it , but [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick ’s lips at present were sealed . [Valancy]83-valancy was glad of this . If [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother had asked if there were any letters [Valancy]83-valancy would have had to admit there was . Then [she]83-valancy would have had to let [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles read the letter and all would be discovered . [Her]83-valancy heart acted strangely on the way [upstairs]2093-upstairs , and [she]83-valancy sat down by [her]83-valancy window for a few minutes before opening [her]83-valancy letter . [She]83-valancy felt very guilty and deceitful . [She]83-valancy had never before kept a letter secret from [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother . Every letter [she]83-valancy had ever written or received had been read by [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick . That had never mattered . [Valancy]83-valancy had never had anything to hide . But thisdidmatter . [She]83-valancy could not have [any one]2045-any one see this letter . But [her]83-valancy fingers trembled with a consciousness of wickedness and unfilial conduct as [she]83-valancy opened it — trembled a little , too , perhaps , with apprehension . [She]83-valancy felt quite sure there was nothing seriously wrong with [her]83-valancy heart but — [one]330-one never knew . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent ’s letter was like [himself]85-dr. trent — blunt , abrupt , concise , wasting no words . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent never beat about the bush . “ [Dear Miss Sterling”—and]141-dear miss sterling”—and[85-dr. trent] then a page of black , positive writing . [Valancy]83-valancy seemed to read it at a glance ; [she]83-valancy dropped it on [her]83-valancy lap , [her]83-valancy face ghost - white . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent told [her]83-valancy that [she]83-valancy had a very dangerous and fatal form of heart disease — angina pectoris — evidently complicated with an aneurism — whatever that was — and in the last stages . [He]85-dr. trent said , without mincing matters , that nothing could be done for [her]83-valancy . If [she]83-valancy took great care of [herself]83-valancy [she]83-valancy might live a year — but [she]83-valancy might also die at any moment — [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent never troubled [himself]85-dr. trent about euphemisms . [She]83-valancy must be careful to avoid all excitement and all severe muscular efforts . [She]83-valancy must eat and drink moderately , [she]83-valancy must never run , [she]83-valancy must go [upstairs]2093-upstairs and uphill with great care . Any sudden jolt or shock might be fatal . [She]83-valancy was to get the prescription [he]85-dr. trent enclosed filled and carry it with [her]83-valancy always , taking a dose whenever [her]83-valancy attacks came on . And [he]85-dr. trent was [hers]83-valancy truly , [H. B. Trent]142-h. b. trent . [Valancy]83-valancy sat for a long while by [her]83-valancy window . Outside was a world drowned in the light of a spring afternoon — skies entrancingly blue , winds perfumed and free , lovely , soft , blue hazes at the end of [every street]666-every street . Over at [the railway station]667-the railway station [a group of young girls]668-a group of young girls was waiting for [a train]669-a train ; [she]83-valancy heard [their]668-a group of young girls gay laughter as [they]668-a group of young girls chattered and joked . [The train]2149-the train roared in and roared out again . But none of these things had any reality . Nothing had any reality except the fact that [she]83-valancy had only another year to live . When [she]83-valancy was tired of sitting at the window [she]83-valancy went over and lay down on [her]83-valancy bed , staring at the cracked , discoloured ceiling . The curious numbness that follows on a staggering blow possessed [her]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy did not feel anything except a boundless surprise and incredulity — behind which was the conviction that [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent knew [his]85-dr. trent business and that [she]83-valancy , [Valancy Stirling]83-valancy , who had never lived , was about to die . When the gong rang for supper [Valancy]83-valancy got up and went [downstairs]361-downstairs mechanically , from force of habit . [She]83-valancy wondered that [she]83-valancy had been let alone so long . But of course [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother would not pay any attention to [her]83-valancy just now . [Valancy]83-valancy was thankful for this . [She]83-valancy thought the quarrel over the rosebush had been really , as [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick [herself]91-mrs. frederick might have said , Providential . [She]83-valancy could not eat anything , but both [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles thought this was because [she]83-valancy was deservedly unhappy over [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s attitude , and [her]83-valancy lack of appetite was not commented on . [Valancy]83-valancy forced [herself]83-valancy to swallow a cup of tea and then sat and watched [the others]674-the others eat , with an odd feeling that years had passed since [she]83-valancy had sat with [them]674-the others at the dinner - table . [She]83-valancy found [herself]83-valancy smiling inwardly to think what a commotion [she]83-valancy could make if [she]83-valancy chose . [I]91-mrs. frederick would not”—here[91-mrs. frederick] [she]91-mrs. frederick looked or seemed to look accusingly right through [Valancy—“havehimto doctor]2168-valancy—“havehimto doctor a sick cat . ”[89-cousin stickles] “ May [I]83-valancy go [upstairs]2093-upstairs and lie down ? ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy faintly . “ [I]83-valancy — [I]83-valancy have a headache . ”[83-valancy] “ What has given [you]83-valancy a headache ? ”[89-cousin stickles] asked [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles , since [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick would not . [She]83-valancy did not care just then if [she]83-valancy were rude . [She]83-valancy had had to be so polite all [her]83-valancy life . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick went on eating [her]91-mrs. frederick supper . It did not matter whether [Valancy]83-valancy was or was not feverish . [Valancy]83-valancy had been guilty of impertinence toher .

[Valancy]83-valancy did not sleep that night . [She]83-valancy lay awake all through the long dark hours — thinking — thinking . [She]83-valancy made a discovery that surprised [her]83-valancy : [she]83-valancy , who had been afraid of almost everything in life , was not afraid of death . It did not seem in the least terrible to [her]83-valancy . And [she]83-valancy need not now be afraid of anything else . Why had [she]83-valancy been afraid of things ? Because of life . Afraid of [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin because of the menace of poverty in old age . But now [she]83-valancy would never be old — neglected — tolerated . Afraid of being [an old maid]337-an old maid all [her]83-valancy life . But now [she]83-valancy would not be [an old maid]337-an old maid very long . Afraid of offending [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [[her]83-valancy clan]328-her clan because [she]83-valancy had to live with and among [them]328-her clan and could n’t live peaceably if [she]83-valancy did n’t give in to [them]328-her clan . But now [she]83-valancy had n’t . [Valancy]83-valancy felt a curious freedom . But [she]83-valancy was still horribly afraid of one thing — the fuss [the whole jamfry of [them]328-her clan]679-the whole jamfry of them would make when [she]83-valancy told [them]328-her clan . [Valancy]83-valancy shuddered at the thought of it . [She]83-valancy could n’t endure it . Oh , [she]83-valancy knew so well how it would be . First there would be indignation — yes , indignation on the part of [Uncle James]99-uncle james because [she]83-valancy had gone to [a doctor]2047-a doctor — [any doctor]681-any doctor — without consulting [HIM]99-uncle james . Indignation on the part of [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother for being so sly and deceitful—“to [[your]2172-your own mother]2173-your own mother , Doss . ”[343-her mother] Indignation on the part of [the whole clan]455-the whole clan because [she]83-valancy had not gone to [Dr. Marsh]110-dr. marsh . Then would come the solicitude . [She]83-valancy would be taken to [Dr. Marsh]110-dr. marsh , and when [Dr. Marsh]110-dr. marsh confirmed [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent ’s diagnosis [she]83-valancy would be taken to [specialists in [Toronto]21-toronto and [Montreal]2-montreal]684-specialists in toronto and montreal . [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin would foot the bill with a splendid gesture of munificence in thus assisting [the widow]685-the widow and [orphan]686-orphan , and talk forever after of the shocking fees [specialists]687-specialists charged for looking wise and saying [they]687-specialists could n’t do anything . And when [the specialists]688-the specialists could do nothing for [her]83-valancy Uncle [James]99-uncle james would insist on [her]83-valancy taking Purple Pills—“I’ve known [them]2174-them to effect a cure [whenallthe doctors]2175-whenallthe doctors had given up”—and[99-uncle james] [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother would insist on [Redfern]112-dr. redfern ’s Blood Bitters , and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles would insist on rubbing [her]83-valancy over the heart every night with [Redfern]112-dr. redfern ’s Liniment on the grounds that itmightdo good andcouldn’tdo harm ; and [everybody else]690-everybody else would have some pet dope for [her]83-valancy to take . [Dr. Stalling]123-dr. stalling would come to [her]83-valancy and say solemnly , “ [You]83-valancy are very ill . Are [you]83-valancy prepared for what may be before you?”—almost[123-dr. stalling] as if [he]123-dr. stalling were going to shake [his]123-dr. stalling forefinger at [her]83-valancy , the forefinger that had not grown any shorter or less knobbly with age . And [she]83-valancy would be watched and checked like [a baby]691-a baby and never let do anything or go anywhere alone . Perhaps [she]83-valancy would not even be allowed to sleep alone lest [she]83-valancy die in [her]83-valancy sleep . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles or [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother would insist on sharing [[her]83-valancy room]369-her room and bed . Yes , undoubtedly [they]694-they would . It was this last thought that really decided [Valancy]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy could not put up with it and [she]83-valancy would n’t . As the clock in [the hall below]496-the hall below struck twelve [Valancy]83-valancy suddenly and definitely made up [her]83-valancy mind that [she]83-valancy would not tell [anybody]2057-anybody . [She]83-valancy had always been told , ever since [she]83-valancy could remember , that [she]83-valancy must hide [her]83-valancy feelings . “ It is not ladylike to have feelings , ”[83-valancy] [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had once told [her]83-valancy disapprovingly . Well , [she]83-valancy would hide them with a vengeance . But though [she]83-valancy was not afraid of death [she]83-valancy was not indifferent to it . [She]83-valancy found that [sheresentedit]697-sheresentedit ; it was not fair that [she]83-valancy should have to die when [she]83-valancy had never lived . Rebellion flamed up in [her]83-valancy soul as the dark hours passed by — not because [she]83-valancy had no future but because [she]83-valancy had no past . “ [I]83-valancy ’m poor — [I’m]83-valancy ugly — [I’m]83-valancy a failure — and [I]83-valancy ’m near death , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy thought . [She]83-valancy could see [her]83-valancy own obituary notice in the DeerwoodWeekly Times , copied into the Port LawrenceJournal . “ A deep gloom was cast over [Deerwood]10-deerwood , etc . , etc . ”—“leaves[83-valancy] a large circle of [friends to mourn , etc . , etc .]698-friends to mourn , etc . , etc . , etc . ”—lies , all lies . Gloom , forsooth ! [Nobody]348-nobody would miss [her]83-valancy . [Her]83-valancy death would not matter a straw to [anybody]2057-anybody . Not even [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother loved [her]83-valancy — [[her]83-valancy mother who had been so disappointed that [she]83-valancy was not [a boy]2108-a boy]2179-her mother who had been so disappointed that she was not a boy — or at least , [a pretty girl]2181-a pretty girl . [Valancy]83-valancy reviewed [her]83-valancy whole life between midnight and the early spring dawn . It was a very drab existence , but here and there an incident loomed out with a significance out of all proportion to its real importance . These incidents were all unpleasant in one way or another . Nothing really pleasant had ever happened to [Valancy]83-valancy . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve never had one wholly happy hour in [my]0-i life — not one , ” [she]0-i thought . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve just been a colourless nonentity . [I]0-i remember reading somewhere once that there is an hour in which [a woman]414-a woman might be happy all [her]414-a woman life if [she]414-a woman could but find it . [I]0-i ’ve never found [my]0-i hour — never , never . And [I]0-i never will now . If [I]0-i could only have had that hour [I]0-i ’d be willing to die . ” Those significant incidents kept bobbing up in [her]83-valancy mind like unbidden ghosts , without any sequence of time or place . For instance , that time when , at sixteen , [she]83-valancy had blued a tubful of clothes too deeply . And the time when , at eight , [she]83-valancy had “[0-i] stolen ” some raspberry jam from [[Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s pantry]2182-aunt wellington ’s pantry . [Valancy]83-valancy never heard the last of those two misdemeanours . At almost every clan gathering [they]700-they were raked up against [her]83-valancy as jokes . [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin hardly ever missed re - telling the raspberry jam incident — [he]100-uncle benjamin had been the one to catch [her]83-valancy , [her]83-valancy face all stained and streaked . “[0-i] [I]0-i have really done so few bad things that [they]700-they have to keep harping on [the old ones]701-the old ones , ” thought [Valancy]83-valancy . “[700-they] Why , [I]0-i ’ve never even had a quarrel with [any one]2045-any one . [I]0-i have n’t [an enemy]703-an enemy . What a spineless thing [I]0-i must be not to have [even one enemy]704-even one enemy ! ” There was that incident of the dust - pile at [school]2183-school when [she]83-valancy was seven . [Valancy]83-valancy always recalled it when [Dr. Stalling]123-dr. stalling referred to the text , “[0-i] To [him]705-him that [hath]706-hath shall be given and from [him]705-him that [hath]706-hath not shall be taken even that which [he]705-him hath . ” [Other people]2030-other people might puzzle over that text but it never puzzled [Valancy]83-valancy . The whole relationship between [herself]83-valancy and [Olive]93-olive , dating from the day of the dust - pile , was a commentary on it . [She]83-valancy had been going to [school]2183-school a year , but [Olive]93-olive , who was a year younger , had just begun and had about [her]93-olive all the glamour of “[2186-a new girl ”] [a new girl ”]2186-a new girl ” and [an exceedingly pretty girl]2187-an exceedingly pretty girl at that . It was at recess and [all the girls , big and little]2188-all the girls , big and little , were out on [the road]2189-the road in front of [the school]2190-the school making dust - piles . The aim of [each girl]2191-each girl was to have the biggest pile . [Valancy]83-valancy was good at making dust - piles — there was an art in it — and [she]83-valancy had secret hopes of leading . But [Olive]93-olive , working off by [herself]93-olive , was suddenly discovered to have a larger dust - pile than [anybody]2057-anybody . [Valancy]83-valancy felt no jealousy . [Her]83-valancy dust - pile was quite big enough to please [her]83-valancy . Then [one of [the older girls]2194-the older girls]2193-one of the older girls had an inspiration . “[2186-a new girl ”] Let ’s put all [our]707-our dust on [Olive]93-olive ’s pile and make a tremendous one , ” [she]83-valancy exclaimed . A frenzy seemed to seize [the girls]2195-the girls . [They]2195-the girls swooped down on the dust - piles with pails and shovels and in a few seconds [Olive]93-olive ’s pile was a veritable pyramid . In vain [Valancy]83-valancy , with scrawny , outstretched little arms , tried to protect [hers]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy was ruthlessly swept aside , [her]83-valancy dust - pile scooped up and poured on [Olive]93-olive ’s . [Valancy]83-valancy turned away resolutely and began building another dust - pile . Again [a bigger girl]2196-a bigger girl pounced on it . [Valancy]83-valancy stood before it , flushed , indignant , arms outspread . “[2186-a new girl ”] Do n’t take it , ” [she]83-valancy pleaded . “[2186-a new girl ”] Please do n’t take it . ” “[2186-a new girl ”] Butwhy ? ” demanded [the older girl]2197-the older girl . “[2186-a new girl ”] Why wo n’t [you]708-her help to build [Olive]93-olive ’s bigger ? ” “[708-her] [I]0-i want [my]0-i own little dust - pile , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy piteously . [Her]83-valancy plea went unheeded . While [she]83-valancy argued with [one girl]2198-one girl [another]2199-another scraped up [her]83-valancy dust - pile . [Valancy]83-valancy turned away , [her]83-valancy heart swelling , [her]83-valancy eyes full of tears . “[0-i] Jealous — [you’re]708-her jealous ! ” said [the girls]2195-the girls mockingly . “[708-her] [You]708-her were very selfish , ” said [[her]708-her mother]343-her mother coldly , when [Valancy]83-valancy told [her]343-her mother about it at night . That was the first and last time [Valancy]83-valancy had ever taken any of [her]708-her troubles to [[her]708-her mother]343-her mother . [Valancy]83-valancy was neither jealous nor selfish . It was only that [she]83-valancy wanted a dust - pile of [her]83-valancy own — small or big mattered not . [A team of horses]2203-a team of horses came down [the street]507-the street — [Olive]93-olive ’s dust pile was scattered over [the roadway]2205-the roadway — the bell rang — [the girls]2195-the girls trooped into [school]2183-school and had forgotten the whole affair before [they]2195-the girls reached [their]2195-the girls seats . [Valancy]83-valancy never forgot it . To this day [she]83-valancy resented it in [her]83-valancy secret soul . But was it not symbolical of [her]83-valancy life ? “[708-her] [I]0-i ’ve never been able to have [my]0-i own dust - pile , ” thought [Valancy]83-valancy . The enormous red moon [she]83-valancy had seen rising right at the end of [the street]507-the street one autumn evening of [her]83-valancy sixth year . [She]83-valancy had been sick and cold with the awful , uncanny horror of it . So near to [her]83-valancy . So big . [She]83-valancy had run in trembling to [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother had laughed at [her]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy had gone to bed and hidden [her]83-valancy face under the clothes in terror lest [she]83-valancy might look at the window and see that horrible moon glaring in at [her]83-valancy through it . [The boy who had tried to kiss [her]83-valancy at a party when [she]83-valancy was fifteen]2211-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen . [She]83-valancy had not let [him]2211-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen — [she]83-valancy had evaded [him]2211-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen and run . [He]2211-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen was [the only boy who had ever tried to kiss [her]83-valancy]2212-the only boy who had ever tried to kiss her . Now , fourteen years later , [Valancy]83-valancy found [herself]83-valancy wishing that [she]83-valancy had let [him]2211-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen . The time [she]83-valancy had been made to apologise to [Olive]93-olive for something [she]83-valancy had n’t done . [Olive]93-olive had said that [Valancy]83-valancy had pushed [her]93-olive into the mud and spoiled [her]93-olive new shoeson purpose . [Valancy]83-valancy knew [she]83-valancy had n’t . It had been an accident — and even that was n’t [her]83-valancy fault — but [nobody]348-nobody would believe [her]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy had to apologise — and kiss [Olive]93-olive to “[0-i] make up . ” The injustice of it burned in [her]83-valancy soul tonight . That summer when [Olive]93-olive had the most beautiful hat , trimmed with creamy yellow net , with a wreath of red roses and little ribbon bows under the chin . [Valancy]83-valancy had wanted a hat like that more than [she]83-valancy had ever wanted anything . [She]83-valancy pleaded for one and had been laughed at — all summer [she]83-valancy had to wear [a horrid little brown sailor with elastic that cut behind [her]83-valancy ears]2214-a horrid little brown sailor with elastic that cut behind her ears . [None of [the girls]2195-the girls]2215-none of the girls would go around with [her]83-valancy because [she]83-valancy was so shabby — nobody but [Olive]93-olive . [People]434-people had thought [Olive]93-olive so sweet and unselfish . “[0-i] [I]0-i was an excellent foil for [her]709-her , ” thought [Valancy]83-valancy . “[0-i] Even then [she]709-her knew that . ” [Valancy]83-valancy had tried to win a prize for attendance in [Sunday School]2218-sunday school once . But [Olive]93-olive won it . There were so many Sundays [Valancy]83-valancy had to stay [home]2135-home because [she]83-valancy had colds . [She]83-valancy had once tried to “[95-god] say a piece ” in [school]2183-school one Friday afternoon and had broken down in it . [Olive]93-olive was [a good reciter]2221-a good reciter and never got stuck . The night [she]83-valancy had spent in [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence with [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel when [she]83-valancy was ten . [Byron Stirling]145-byron was [there]370-there ; from [Montreal]2-montreal , twelve years old , conceited , clever . At family prayers in the morning [Byron]145-byron had reached across and given [Valancy]83-valancy ’s thin arm such a savage pinch that [she]83-valancy screamed out with pain . [He]145-byron said [she]83-valancy had put the kitten up on [her]83-valancy chair and was playing with it when [she]83-valancy should have been listening to [Uncle David]146-uncle david ’s prayer . [He]145-byron wasbelieved . In [the Stirling clan]2062-the stirling clan [the boys]2224-the boys were always believed before [the girls]2195-the girls . The time [Cousin Betty Stirling]147-betty was married . But tonight [Valancy]83-valancy caught [her]83-valancy breath with the old pain and sting of it . That day in [her]83-valancy eleventh year when [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother had badgered [her]83-valancy into confessing something [she]83-valancy had never done . [Valancy]83-valancy had denied it for a long time but eventually for peace ’ sake [she]83-valancy had given in and pleaded guilty . [She]83-valancy had never had [a voluntary partner]2234-a voluntary partner . The affair of the button - string , when [she]93-olive was ten . [All the girls in school]2239-all the girls in school had button - strings . [Olive]93-olive had a very long one with a great many beautiful buttons . [Valancy]83-valancy had one . Most of the buttons on it were very commonplace , but [she]83-valancy had six beauties that had come off [Grandmother Stirling]149-grandmother stirling ’s wedding - gown — sparkling buttons of gold and glass , much more beautiful than any [Olive]93-olive had . [Their]2240-their possession conferred a certain distinction on [Valancy]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy knew [every little girl in [school]2183-school]2241-every little girl in school envied [her]83-valancy the exclusive possession of those beautiful buttons . When [Olive]93-olive saw them on the button - string [she]93-olive had looked at them narrowly but said nothing — then . The next day [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington had come to [Elm Street]5-elm street and told [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick that [she]84-aunt wellington thought [Olive]93-olive should have some of those buttons — [Grandmother Stirling]149-grandmother stirling was just as much [[Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s mother]2243-wellington ’s mother as [Frederick]91-mrs. frederick ’s . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick had agreed amiably . [She]91-mrs. frederick could not afford to fall out with [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington . Moreover , the matter was of no importance whatever . [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington carried off four of the buttons , generously leaving two for [Valancy]83-valancy . [Valancy]83-valancy had torn these from [her]83-valancy string and flung them on the floor — [she]83-valancy had not yet learned that it was unladylike to have feelings — and had been sent supperless to bed for the exhibition . The night of [Margaret Blunt]150-margaret blunt ’s party . [She]83-valancy had made such pathetic efforts to be pretty that night . [Rob Walker]151-rob was to be [there]370-there ; and two nights before , on the moonlit verandah of [[Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert ’s cottage at [Mistawis]22-mistawis]2245-uncle herbert ’s cottage at mistawis , [Rob]151-rob had really seemed attracted to [her]83-valancy .
