That , of course , was years ago . [People in [Deerwood]10-deerwood]2246-people in deerwood had long since given up inviting [Valancy]83-valancy to dances . But to [Valancy]83-valancy [its]10-deerwood humiliation and disappointment were of the other day . [Her]83-valancy face burned in the darkness as [she]83-valancy recalled [herself]83-valancy , sitting there with [her]83-valancy pitifully crimped , thin hair and the cheeks [she]83-valancy had pinched for an hour before coming , in an effort to make them red . All that came of it was a wild story that [Valancy Stirling]83-valancy was rouged at [Margaret Blunt]150-margaret blunt ’s party . In those days in [Deerwood]10-deerwood that was enough to wreck [your]2247-your character forever . It did not wreck [Valancy]83-valancy ’s , or even damage it . [People]434-people knewshecouldn’t be fast if [she]83-valancy tried . [They]434-people only laughed at [her]83-valancy . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve had nothing but a second - hand existence , ” decided [Valancy]83-valancy . “[0-i] All the great emotions of life have passed [me]0-i by . [I]0-i ’ve never even had a grief . And have [I]0-i ever really loved [anybody]2057-anybody ? Do [I]0-i really love [Mother]88-mother ? No , [I]0-i do n’t . That ’s the truth , whether it is disgraceful or not . [I]0-i do n’t love [her]88-mother — [I’ve]0-i never loved [her]88-mother . What ’s worse , [I]0-i do n’t even like [her]88-mother . So [I]0-i do n’t know anything about any kind of love . [My]0-i life has been empty — empty . Nothing is worse than emptiness . Nothing ! ” [Valancy]83-valancy ejaculated the last “[88-mother] nothing ” aloud passionately . Then [she]0-i moaned and stopped thinking about anything for a while . One of [her]0-i attacks of pain had come on . When it was over something had happened to [Valancy]83-valancy — perhaps the culmination of the process that had been going on in [her]0-i mind ever since [she]0-i had read [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent ’s letter . It was three o’clock in the morning — the wisest and most accursed hour of the clock . But sometimes it sets [us]2249-us free . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve been trying to please [other people]2030-other people all [my]0-i life and failed , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] After this [I]0-i shall please [myself]0-i . [I]0-i shall never pretend anything again . [I]0-i ’ve breathed an atmosphere of fibs and pretences and evasions all [my]0-i life . What a luxury it will be to tell the truth ! [I]0-i may not be able to do much that [I]0-i want to do but [I]0-i wo n’t do another thing that [I]0-i do n’t want to do . [Mother]88-mother can pout for weeks — [I]0-i sha n’t worry over it . ‘ [Despair]152-despair is [a free man]712-a free man — hope is [a slave]713-a slave . ’ ” [Valancy]83-valancy got up and dressed , with a deepening of that curious sense of freedom . When [she]83-valancy had finished with [her]83-valancy hair [she]83-valancy opened the window and hurled the jar of potpourri over into [the next lot]461-the next lot . [Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert and [Aunt Alberta]96-aunt alberta ’s silver wedding was delicately referred to among [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings during the following weeks as “ the time [we]2252-we first noticed [poor Valancy]83-valancy was — a little — [you]2253-you understand ? ”[86-the stirlings] Not for worlds would [any of [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings]714-any of the stirlings have said out and out at first that [Valancy]83-valancy had gone mildly insane or even that [her]83-valancy mind was slightly deranged . But [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had noticed a few things that made [them]715-them uneasybeforethe dinner . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick had recourse to tears , having found outraged majesty had ceased to be effective . “ What have [you]89-cousin stickles got against [the Anglican church]2067-the anglican church ? ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy sobbed . “ Nothing — only just that [you]89-cousin stickles ’ve always made [me]83-valancy go [there]370-there . So [Valancy]83-valancy ’s behaviour at the silver wedding was not quite the surprise to [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Christine Stickles]114-christine stickles that it was to the rest . [They]721-they were doubtful about the wisdom of taking [her]83-valancy , but concluded it would “ make talk ”[721-they] if [they]721-they did n’t . Perhaps [she]83-valancy would behave [herself]83-valancy , and so far [no outsider]722-no outsider suspected there was anything queer about [her]83-valancy . [Valancy]83-valancy would not have cared in the least if [they]721-they had left [her]83-valancy at [home]2135-home . These family celebrations were all hopelessly dull . But [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings always celebrated everything . It was a long - established custom . [Even Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick gave a dinner party on [her]91-mrs. frederick wedding anniversary and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had [friends]2077-friends in to supper on [her]89-cousin stickles birthday . [Valancy]83-valancy hated these entertainments because [they]721-they had to pinch and save and contrive for weeks afterwards to pay for them . But [she]83-valancy wanted to go to the silver wedding . It would hurt [Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert ’s feelings if [she]83-valancy stayed away , and [she]83-valancy rather liked [Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert . Besides , [she]83-valancy wanted to look over all [[her]83-valancy relatives]727-her relatives from [her]83-valancy new angle . It would be an excellent place to make public [her]83-valancy declaration of independence if occasion offered . “ Put on [your]83-valancy brown silk dress , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Stirling]91-mrs. frederick . As if there were anything else to put on ! [Valancy]83-valancy had only the one festive dress — that snuffy - brown silk [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel had given [her]83-valancy . [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel had decreed that [Valancy]83-valancy should never wear colours . [They]728-they did not become [her]83-valancy . When [she]83-valancy was young [they]728-they allowed [her]83-valancy to wear white , but that had been tacitly dropped for some years . [Valancy]83-valancy put on the brown silk . [It]729-it had a high collar and long sleeves . [She]83-valancy had never had a dress with low neck and elbow sleeves , although they had been worn , even in [Deerwood]10-deerwood , for over a year . But [she]83-valancy did not do [her]83-valancy hair pompadour . [She]83-valancy knotted it on [her]83-valancy neck and pulled it out over [her]83-valancy ears . [She]83-valancy thought it became [her]83-valancy — only the little knot was so absurdly small . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick resented the hair but decided it was wisest to say nothing on the eve of the party . It was so important that [Valancy]83-valancy should be kept in good humour , if possible , until it was over . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick did not reflect that this was the first time in [her]91-mrs. frederick life that [she]91-mrs. frederick had thought it necessary to consider [Valancy]83-valancy ’s humours . But then [Valancy]83-valancy had never been “ queer ”[83-valancy] before . On [their]728-they way to [Uncle Herbert’s]155-uncle herbert’s — [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles walking in front , [Valancy]83-valancy trotting meekly along behind — [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel drove past [them]728-they . Drunk as usual but not in the roaring stage . Just drunk enough to be excessively polite . [He]133-roaring abel raised [his]133-roaring abel disreputable old tartan cap with the air of [a monarch saluting [[his]133-roaring abel subjects]731-his subjects]730-a monarch saluting his subjects and swept [them]731-his subjects a grand bow . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles dared not cut [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel altogether . [He]133-roaring abel was [the only person in [Deerwood]10-deerwood who could be got to do odd jobs of carpentering and repairing when [they]733-they needed to be done]732-the only person in deerwood who could be got to do odd jobs of carpentering and repairing when they needed to be done , so it would not do to offend [him]133-roaring abel . But [they]728-they responded with only the stiffest , slightest of bows . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel must be kept in [his]133-roaring abel place . [Valancy]83-valancy , behind [them]728-they , did a thing [they]728-they were fortunately spared seeing . [She]83-valancy smiled gaily and waved [her]83-valancy hand to [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel . Why not ? [She]83-valancy had always liked [the old sinner]734-the old sinner . [He]133-roaring abel was such [a jolly , picturesque , unashamed reprobate]735-a jolly , picturesque , unashamed reprobate and stood out against the drab respectability of [Deerwood]10-deerwood and [its]10-deerwood customs like a flame - red flag of revolt and protest . Only a few nights ago [Abel]133-roaring abel had gone through [Deerwood]10-deerwood in [the wee sma ’s]736-the wee sma ’s , shouting oaths at the top of [his]133-roaring abel stentorian voice which could be heard for miles , and lashing [his]133-roaring abel horse into a furious gallop as [he]133-roaring abel tore along prim , proper [Elm Street]5-elm street . “ Yelling and blaspheming like [a fiend]2264-a fiend , ”[89-cousin stickles] shuddered [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles at the breakfast - table . “ [I]91-mrs. frederick can not understand why the judgment of [the Lord]2265-the lord has not fallen upon [that man]2266-that man long ere this , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick petulantly , as if [she]91-mrs. frederick thought [Providence]113-providence was very dilatory and ought to have a gentle reminder . “ [He]2266-that man ’ll be picked up dead some morning — [he’ll]2266-that man fall under [his]2266-that man horse ’s hoofs and be trampled to death , ”[89-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles reassuringly . [Valancy]83-valancy had said nothing , of course ; but [she]83-valancy wondered to [herself]83-valancy if [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel ’s periodical sprees were not [his]133-roaring abel futile protest against the poverty and drudgery and monotony of [his]133-roaring abel existence . Shewent on dream sprees in [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel , having no imagination , could not do that . Hisescapes from reality had to be concrete . So [she]83-valancy waved at [him]133-roaring abel today with a sudden fellow feeling , and [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel , not too drunk to be astonished , nearly fell off [his]133-roaring abel seat in [his]133-roaring abel amazement . By this time [they]738-they had reached [Maple Avenue]25-maple avenue and [[Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert ’s house]739-uncle herbert ’s house , [a large , pretentious structure peppered with meaningless bay windows and [excrescent porches]741-excrescent porches]740-a large , pretentious structure peppered with meaningless bay windows and excrescent porches . What had [Valancy]83-valancy said ? Was it profane ? Or only just queer ? “ Bless this food to [our]2269-our use and consecrate [our]2269-our lives to [Thy]2270-thy service , ”[97-uncle herbert] said [Uncle Herbert]97-uncle herbert briskly . [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington frowned . [She]84-aunt wellington always considered [Herbert]97-uncle herbert ’s graces entirely too short and “ flippant . ”[84-aunt wellington] A grace , to be a grace in [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington ’s eyes , had to be at least three minutes long and uttered in an unearthly tone , between a groan and a chant . As a protest [she]84-aunt wellington kept [her]84-aunt wellington head bent a perceptible time after all the rest had been lifted . When [she]84-aunt wellington permitted [herself]84-aunt wellington to sit upright [she]84-aunt wellington found [Valancy]83-valancy looking at [her]84-aunt wellington . Such a thing was unthinkable , of course . [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington at once ceased to think it . [Valancy]83-valancy was enjoying [herself]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy had never enjoyed [herself]83-valancy at a “ family reunion ”[83-valancy] before . [She]83-valancy had no parlour tricks . And [she]83-valancy had been in the habit of taking refuge from the boredom of family parties in [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle , which resulted in an absent - mindedness that increased [her]83-valancy reputation for dulness and vacuity . “ [She]83-valancy has no social presence whatever , ”[84-aunt wellington] [Aunt Wellington]84-aunt wellington had decreed once and for all . Now [she]83-valancy was no longer afraid of [them]751-them . The shackles had been stricken off [her]83-valancy soul . [She]83-valancy was quite prepared to talk if occasion offered . Meanwhile [she]83-valancy was giving [herself]83-valancy such freedom of thought as [she]83-valancy had never dared to take before . Rich , golden - brown hair , elaborately dressed , with a sparkling bandeau holding its glossy puffs in place ; large , brilliant blue eyes and thick silken lashes ; face of rose and bare neck of snow , rising above [her]93-olive gown ; great pearl bubbles in [her]93-olive ears ; the blue - white diamond flame on [her]93-olive long , smooth , waxen finger with its rosy , pointed nail . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick said the greatest happiness was to spend [your]819-your life in loving service for [others]820-others , and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles and [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel agreed with [her]91-mrs. frederick — [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel with a resentful air , as if [she]101-aunt isabel thought [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick had taken the wind out of [her]101-aunt isabel sails by saying it first . “ [We]2286-we are all too prone , ”[91-mrs. frederick] continued [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick , determined not to lose so good an opportunity , “ to live in selfishness , worldliness and sin . ”[91-mrs. frederick] [The other women]821-the other women all felt rebuked for [their]821-the other women low ideals , and [Uncle James]99-uncle james had a conviction that the conversation had been uplifted with a vengeance . “ The greatest happiness , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy suddenly and distinctly , “ is to sneeze when [you]2287-you want to . ”[83-valancy] [Everybody]423-everybody stared . [Nobody]348-nobody felt it safe to say anything . Was [Valancy]83-valancy trying to be funny ? It was incredible . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick , who had been breathing easier since the dinner had progressed so far without any outbreak on the part of [Valancy]83-valancy , began to tremble again . But [she]91-mrs. frederick deemed it the part of prudence to say nothing . [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin was not so prudent . [He]100-uncle benjamin rashly rushed in where [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick feared to tread . “ Doss , ”[100-uncle benjamin] [he]100-uncle benjamin chuckled , “ what is the difference between [a young girl]2288-a young girl and [an old maid]337-an old maid ? ”[100-uncle benjamin] “ [One]330-one is happy and careless and the other is cappy and hairless , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [You]100-uncle benjamin have asked that riddle at least fifty times in [my]83-valancy recollection , [Uncle Ben]100-uncle benjamin . [Valancy]83-valancy hurried [home]2135-home through the faint blue twilight — hurried too fast perhaps . The attack [she]83-valancy had when [she]83-valancy thankfully reached the shelter of [[her]83-valancy own room]870-her own room was the worst yet . It was really very bad . [She]83-valancy might die in one of those spells . It would be dreadful to die in such pain . Perhaps — perhaps this was death . [Valancy]83-valancy felt pitifully alone . When [she]83-valancy could think at all [she]83-valancy wondered what it would be like to have [some one with [her]83-valancy who could sympathise]871-some one with her who could sympathise — [some one who really cared]872-some one who really cared — just to hold [her]83-valancy hand tight , if nothing else — some one just to say , “ Yes , [I]481-some one know . Life can not stop because tragedy enters it . Meals must be made ready though [a son]897-a son dies and [porches]898-porches must be repaired even if [[your]899-your only daughter]900-your only daughter is going out of [her]900-your only daughter mind . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick , in [her]91-mrs. frederick systematic way , had long ago appointed the second week in June for the repairing of [the front porch]901-the front porch , the roof of which was sagging dangerously . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel had been engaged to do it many moons before and [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel promptly appeared on the morning of the first day of the second week , and fell to work . Of course [he]133-roaring abel was drunk . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel was never anything but drunk . But [he]133-roaring abel was only in the first stage , which made [him]133-roaring abel talkative and genial . The odour of whisky on [his]133-roaring abel breath nearly drove [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles wild at dinner . [Even Valancy]83-valancy , with all [her]83-valancy emancipation , did not like it . But [she]83-valancy liked [Abel]133-roaring abel and [she]83-valancy liked [his]133-roaring abel vivid , eloquent talk , and after [she]83-valancy washed the dinner dishes [she]83-valancy went out and sat on the steps and talked to [him]133-roaring abel . [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles thought it a terrible proceeding , but what could [they]902-they do ? [Valancy]83-valancy only smiled mockingly at [them]902-they when [they]902-they called [her]83-valancy in , and did not go . It was so easy to defy once [you]903-you got started . The first step was the only one that really counted . [They]902-they were both afraid to say anything more to [her]83-valancy lest [she]83-valancy might make a scene before [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel , who would spread it all over [the country]2313-the country with [his]133-roaring abel own characteristic comments and exaggerations . It was too cold a day , in spite of the June sunshine , for [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick to sit at the dining - room window and listen to what was said . [She]91-mrs. frederick had to shut the window and [Valancy]83-valancy and [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel had [their]902-they talk to [themselves]902-they . But if [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick had known what the outcome of that talk was to be [she]91-mrs. frederick would have prevented it , if [the porch]905-the porch was never repaired . [Valancy]83-valancy sat on the steps , defiant of the chill breeze of this cold June which had made [Aunt Isabel]101-aunt isabel aver the seasons were changing . [She]83-valancy did not care whether [she]83-valancy caught a cold or not . It was delightful to sit there in [that cold , beautiful , fragrant world]906-that cold , beautiful , fragrant world and feel free . [She]83-valancy filled [her]83-valancy lungs with the clean , lovely wind and held out [her]83-valancy arms to it and let it tear [her]83-valancy hair to pieces while [she]83-valancy listened to [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel , who told [her]83-valancy [his]133-roaring abel troubles between intervals of hammering gaily in time to [his]133-roaring abel Scotch songs . [Valancy]83-valancy liked to hear [him]133-roaring abel . Every stroke of [his]133-roaring abel hammer fell true to the note . [Old Abel Gay]185-abel , in spite of [his]185-abel seventy years , was handsome still , in a stately , patriarchal manner . [His]185-abel tremendous beard , falling down over [his]185-abel blue flannel shirt , was still a flaming , untouched red , though [his]185-abel shock of hair was white as snow , and [his]185-abel eyes were a fiery , youthful blue . [His]185-abel enormous , reddish - white eyebrows were more like moustaches than eyebrows . Perhaps this was why [he]185-abel always kept [his]185-abel upper lip scrupulously shaved . [His]185-abel cheeks were red and [his]185-abel nose ought to have been , but was n’t . It was a fine , upstanding , aquiline nose , such as [the noblest Roman of [them]908-them]907-the noblest roman of them all might have rejoiced in . [Abel]185-abel was six feet two in [his]185-abel stockings , broad - shouldered , lean - hipped . In [his]185-abel youth [he]185-abel had been [a famous lover]909-a famous lover , finding [all women]910-all women too charming to bind [himself]185-abel to one . [His]185-abel years had been a wild , colourful panorama of follies and adventures , gallantries , fortunes and misfortunes . [He]185-abel had been forty - five before [he]185-abel married — [a pretty slip of [a girl whom [his]185-abel goings - on killed in a few years]912-a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years]911-a pretty slip of a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years . [Abel]185-abel was piously drunk at [her]912-a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years funeral and insisted on repeating the fifty - fifth chapter of Isaiah — [Abel]185-abel knew most of the Bible and all the Psalms by heart — while [the minister]913-the minister , whom [he]185-abel disliked , prayed or tried to pray . Thereafter [[his]185-abel house]914-his house was run by [an untidy old cousin who cooked [his]185-abel meals and kept things going after a fashion . In this unpromising environment [little Cecilia Gay]172-cissy had grown up]915-an untidy old cousin who cooked his meals and kept things going after a fashion . in this unpromising environment little cecilia gay had grown up . [He]186-rev. mr. bently had called on [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel then and found [him]133-roaring abel in the theological stage of drunkenness — which always followed the sentimental maudlin one , and preceded [the roaring , blasphemous one]927-the roaring , blasphemous one . [Everybody]423-everybody liked [Cissy Gay]172-cissy and was sorry for [her]172-cissy . [She]172-cissy was so modest and sensitive and pretty in that delicate , elusive fashion of beauty which fades so quickly if life is not kept in it by love and tenderness . But then liking and pity did not prevent [them]933-the church people from tearing [her]172-cissy in pieces like hungry cats when the catastrophe came . Four years previously [Cissy Gay]172-cissy had gone up to [a Muskoka hotel]939-a muskoka hotel as [a summer waitress]940-a summer waitress . And when [she]172-cissy had come back in the fall [she]172-cissy was [a changed creature]941-a changed creature . [She]172-cissy hid [herself]172-cissy away and went nowhere . [Frederick]91-mrs. frederick hunted for a dry spot on [her]91-mrs. frederick handkerchief—“is that [every one]419-every one will know now that [she]91-mrs. frederick is deranged . [We]2431-we ca n’t keep it a secret any longer . Oh , [I]100-uncle benjamin can not bear it ! ”[100-uncle benjamin] “ [You]100-uncle benjamin should have been stricter with [her]91-mrs. frederick when [she]91-mrs. frederick was young , ”[100-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin . “ [I]91-mrs. frederick do n’t see how [I]91-mrs. frederick could have been , ”[91-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick — truthfully enough . “ The worst feature of the case is that [Snaith scoundrel]2432-snaith scoundrel is always hanging around [Roaring Abel ’s]133-roaring abel , ”[99-uncle james] said [Uncle James]99-uncle james . “ [I]99-uncle james shall be thankful if nothing worse comes of [this mad freak]2433-this mad freak than a few weeks at Roaring [Abel]133-roaring abel ’s . [Valancy]83-valancy had walked out to [[Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel ’s house]953-roaring abel ’s house on [the Mistawis road]969-the mistawis road under a sky of purple and amber , with a queer exhilaration and expectancy in [her]83-valancy heart . Back there , behind [her]83-valancy , [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles were crying — over [themselves]975-themselves , not over [her]83-valancy . But here the wind was in [her]83-valancy face , soft , dew - wet , cool , blowing along [the grassy roads]976-the grassy roads . Oh , [she]83-valancy loved the wind ! The robins were whistling sleepily in the firs along the way and the moist air was fragrant with the tang of balsam . [Big cars]977-big cars went purring past in the violet dusk — the stream of [summer tourists to [Muskoka]12-muskoka]978-summer tourists to muskoka had already begun — but [Valancy]83-valancy did not envy [any of [[their]977-big cars occupants]980-their occupants]979-any of their occupants . [[Muskoka]12-muskoka cottages]981-muskoka cottages might be charming , but beyond , in the sunset skies , among the spires of the firs , [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle towered . [She]83-valancy brushed the old years and habits and inhibitions away from [her]83-valancy like dead leaves . [She]83-valancy would not be littered with them . [[Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house was situated about three miles from [the village]587-the village , on the very edge of “ up back , ”[83-valancy] as [the sparsely settled , hilly , wooded country around [Mistawis]22-mistawis]985-the sparsely settled , hilly , wooded country around mistawis was called vernacularly . [It]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house did not , it must be confessed , look much like [a Blue Castle]3-the blue castle . [It]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house had once been [a snug place]986-a snug place enough in the days when [Abel Gay]133-roaring abel had been young and prosperous , and the punning , arched sign over the gate—“A. Gay , Carpenter , ”[133-roaring abel] had been fine and freshly painted . Now [it]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house was [a faded , dreary old place]987-a faded , dreary old place , with a leprous , patched roof and shutters hanging askew . [Abel]133-roaring abel never seemed to do any carpenter jobs about [[his]133-roaring abel own house]988-his own house . [It]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house had a listless air , as if tired of life . There was a dwindling grove of ragged , crone - like old spruces behind [it]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house . [The garden]989-the garden , which [Cissy]198-cissy gaycan’tlive used to keep neat and pretty , had run wild . On two sides of [the house]360-the house were [fields full of nothing but mulleins]991-fields full of nothing but mulleins . Behind [the house]360-the house was a long stretch of useless barrens , full of scrub pines and spruces , with here and there a blossoming bit of wild cherry , running back to a belt of timber on [the shores of [Lake Mistawis]18-lake mistawis]993-the shores of lake mistawis , two miles away . [A rough , rocky , boulder - strewn lane]994-a rough , rocky , boulder - strewn lane ran through [it]983-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house to [the woods]427-the woods — a lane white with pestiferous , beautiful daisies . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel met [Valancy]83-valancy at the door . “ So [you]83-valancy ’ve come , ”[133-roaring abel] [he]133-roaring abel said incredulously . “ [I]133-roaring abel never s’posed that ruck of [Stirlings]86-the stirlings would let [you]83-valancy . ”[133-roaring abel] [Valancy]83-valancy showed all [her]83-valancy pointed teeth in a grin . “ [They]2435-they could n’t stop [me]83-valancy . ”[83-valancy] “ [I]133-roaring abel did n’t think [you]83-valancy ’d so much spunk , ”[133-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel admiringly . “ And look at the nice ankles of [her]83-valancy , ”[133-roaring abel] [he]133-roaring abel added , as [he]133-roaring abel stepped aside to let [her]83-valancy in . If [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles had heard this [she]89-cousin stickles would have been certain that [Valancy]83-valancy ’s doom , earthly and unearthly , was sealed . But [Abel]133-roaring abel ’s superannuated gallantry did not worry [Valancy]83-valancy . Besides , this was the first compliment [she]83-valancy had ever received in [her]83-valancy life and [she]83-valancy found [herself]83-valancy liking it . [She]83-valancy sometimes suspected [she]83-valancy had nice ankles , but [nobody]348-nobody had ever mentioned it before . In [the Stirling clan]2062-the stirling clan ankles were among the unmentionables . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel took [her]83-valancy into [the kitchen]2414-the kitchen , where [Cissy Gay]172-cissy was lying on the sofa , breathing quickly , with little scarlet spots on [her]172-cissy hollow cheeks . [Valancy]83-valancy had not seen [Cecilia Gay]172-cissy for years . Then [she]172-cissy had been such [a pretty creature]999-a pretty creature , [a slight , blossom - like girl , with soft , golden hair , clear - cut , almost waxen features , and large , beautiful blue eyes]1000-a slight , blossom - like girl , with soft , golden hair , clear - cut , almost waxen features , and large , beautiful blue eyes . [She]83-valancy was shocked at the change in [her]172-cissy . Could this be sweet [Cissy]172-cissy — this pitiful little thing that looked like a tired , broken flower ? [She]172-cissy had wept all the beauty out of [her]172-cissy eyes ; they looked too big — enormous — in [her]172-cissy wasted face . The last time [Valancy]83-valancy had seen [Cecilia Gay]172-cissy [those]1001-those faded , piteous eyes had been limpid , shadowy blue pools aglow with mirth . The contrast was so terrible that [Valancy]83-valancy ’s own eyes filled with tears . [She]83-valancy knelt down by [Cissy]172-cissy and put [her]83-valancy arms about [her]172-cissy . “ [Cissy]172-cissy dear , [I]83-valancy ’ve come to look after [you]172-cissy . [You]172-cissy were always — so sweet to [me]172-cissy — long ago . ”[172-cissy] [Valancy]83-valancy held [Cissy]172-cissy close . [She]83-valancy was suddenly happy . Here was [some one who needed [her]83-valancy]1002-some one who needed her — [some one [she]83-valancy could help]1003-some one she could help . [She]83-valancy was no longer a superfluity . Old things had passed away ; everything had become new . “ Most things are predestinated , but some are just darn sheer luck , ”[133-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel , complacently smoking [his]133-roaring abel pipe in the corner .

When [Valancy]83-valancy had lived for a week at [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel ’s [she]83-valancy felt as if years had separated [her]83-valancy from [her]83-valancy old life and [all the people [she]83-valancy had known in it]1004-all the people she had known in it . [They]1005-they were beginning to seem remote — dream - like — far - away — and as the days went on they seemed still more so , until they ceased to matter altogether . [She]83-valancy was happy . [Nobody]348-nobody ever bothered [her]83-valancy with conundrums or insisted on giving [her]83-valancy Purple Pills . [Nobody]348-nobody called [her]83-valancy Doss or worried [her]83-valancy about catching cold . There were no quilts to piece , no abominable rubber - plant to water , no ice - cold maternal tantrums to endure . [She]83-valancy could be alone whenever [she]83-valancy liked , go to bed when [she]83-valancy liked , sneeze when [she]83-valancy liked . In the long , wondrous , northern twilights , when [Cissy]172-cissy was asleep and [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel away , [she]83-valancy could sit for hours on [the shaky back verandah steps]1008-the shaky back verandah steps , looking out over [the barrens]1009-the barrens to [the hills beyond , covered with their fine , purple bloom]1010-the hills beyond , covered with their fine , purple bloom , listening to the friendly wind singing wild , sweet melodies in the little spruces , and drinking in the aroma of the sunned grasses , until darkness flowed over [the landscape]1011-the landscape like a cool , welcome wave . Sometimes of an afternoon , when [Cissy]172-cissy was strong enough , [the two girls]1012-the two girls went into [the barrens]1009-the barrens and looked at the wood - flowers . But [they]1012-the two girls did not pick any . [Valancy]83-valancy had read to [Cissy]172-cissy the gospel thereof according to [John Foster]106-john foster : “ It is a pity to gather wood - flowers . [They]2436-their lose half [their]2436-their witchery away from the green and the flicker . The way to enjoy wood - flowers is to track [them]2436-their down to [[their]2436-their remote haunts]2437-their remote haunts — gloat over [them]2436-their — and then leave [them]2436-their with backward glances , taking with [us]2438-us only the beguiling memory of [their]2436-their grace and fragrance . ”[106-john foster] [Valancy]83-valancy was in the midst of realities after a lifetime of unrealities . And busy — very busy . [The house]360-the house had to be cleaned . Not for nothing had [Valancy]83-valancy been brought up in the [Stirling]83-valancy habits of neatness and cleanliness . If [she]83-valancy found satisfaction in cleaning [dirty rooms]1015-dirty rooms [she]83-valancy got [her]83-valancy fill of it [there]370-there . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel thought [she]83-valancy was foolish to bother doing so much more than [she]83-valancy was asked to do , but [he]133-roaring abel did not interfere with [her]83-valancy . [He]133-roaring abel was very well satisfied with [his]133-roaring abel bargain . [Valancy]83-valancy was [a good cook]1017-a good cook . Theydon’t like being sassed back . ”[133-roaring abel] During the day [Abel]133-roaring abel was generally away from [home]2135-home — if not working , then shooting or fishing with [Barney Snaith]132-barney . [Valancy]83-valancy was acquainted with [Barney]132-barney by now — well acquainted , it seemed , though [she]83-valancy had spoken to [him]1033-his only a few times . But then [she]83-valancy had felt just as well acquainted with [him]1033-his the first time [they]1034-they had met . [She]83-valancy had been in [the garden]989-the garden at twilight , hunting for a few stalks of white narcissus for [[Cissy]172-cissy ’s room]1022-cissy ’s room when [she]83-valancy heard that terrible old Grey Slosson coming down through [the woods]427-the woods from [Mistawis]22-mistawis — [one]330-one could hear it miles away . [Valancy]83-valancy did not look up as it drew near , thumping over the rocks in [that crazy lane]1039-that crazy lane . [She]83-valancy had never looked up , though [Barney]132-barney had gone racketting past every evening since [she]83-valancy had been at [Roaring Abel ’s]133-roaring abel . This time [he]1033-his did not racket past . [The old Grey Slosson]204-lady jane stopped with even more terrible noises than [it]204-lady jane made going . [Valancy]83-valancy was conscious that [Barney]132-barney had sprung from it and was leaning over the ramshackle gate . [She]83-valancy suddenly straightened up and looked into [his]1033-his face . [Their]1040-their eyes met — [Valancy]83-valancy was suddenly conscious of a delicious weakness . Was one of [her]83-valancy heart attacks coming on?—But this was a new symptom . [His]1033-his eyes , which [she]83-valancy had always thought brown , now seen close , were deep violet — translucent and intense . Neither of [his]1033-his eyebrows looked like the other . [He]1033-his was thin — too thin — [she]83-valancy wished [she]83-valancy could feed [him]1033-his up a bit — [she]83-valancy wished [she]83-valancy could sew the buttons on [his]1033-his coat — and make [him]1033-his cut [his]1033-his hair — and shave every day . There wassomethingin [his]1033-his face — [one]330-one hardly knew what it was . Tiredness ? Sadness ? Disillusionment ? [He]1033-his had dimples in [his]1033-his thin cheeks when [he]1033-his smiled . All these thoughts flashed through [Valancy]83-valancy ’s mind in that one moment while [his]1033-his eyes looked into [hers]83-valancy . “ Good - evening , [Miss Stirling]164-olive . ”[1033-his] Nothing could be more commonplace and conventional . [Any one]2045-any one might have said it . But [Barney Snaith]132-barney had a way of saying things that gave [them]1043-them poignancy . When [he]1033-his said good - evening [you]1044-you felt that itwasa good evening and that it was partly [his]1033-his doing that it was . Also , [you]1044-you felt that some of the credit was [yours]1044-you . [Valancy]83-valancy felt all this vaguely , but [she]83-valancy could n’t imagine why [she]83-valancy was trembling from head to foot — itmustbe [her]83-valancy heart . [She]83-valancy knew [he]1047-i would bring oranges for [Cissy]172-cissy anyhow — [he]1047-i always did . [Barney]132-barney did not turn away at once . [He]1047-i was silent for a little . Then [he]1047-i said , slowly and whimsically : “ [Miss Stirling]164-olive , [you]164-olive ’re a brick ! [You]164-olive ’re a whole cartload of bricks . To come here and look after [Cissy]172-cissy — under the circumstances . ”[1047-i] “ There ’s nothing so bricky about that , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [I]1047-i ’d nothing else to do . [She]83-valancy never slams doors , and when [she]83-valancy has nothing to say [she]83-valancy do n’t talk . That ’s uncanny in [a woman]414-a woman , [you]2482-mister know , [Mister]2482-mister . It would really have been so much easier to bear if [Valancy]83-valancy had died . [She]83-valancy could have worn mourning then .

When [Abel Gay]133-roaring abel paid [Valancy]83-valancy [her]83-valancy first month ’s wages — which [he]133-roaring abel did promptly , in bills reeking with the odour of tobacco and whiskey — [Valancy]83-valancy went into [Deerwood]10-deerwood and spent every cent of it . [She]83-valancy got a pretty green crêpe dress with a girdle of crimson beads , at a bargain sale , a pair of silk stockings , to match , and a little crinkled green hat with a crimson rose in it . [She]83-valancy even bought a foolish little beribboned and belaced nightgown . [She]83-valancy passed [the house on [Elm Street]5-elm street]1104-the house on elm street twice — [Valancy]83-valancy never even thought about it as “ home”—but[83-valancy] saw [no one]485-no one . No doubt [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother was sitting in [the room]443-the room this lovely June evening playing solitaire — and cheating . [Valancy]83-valancy knew that [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick always cheated . [She]83-valancy never lost a game . [Most of [the people [Valancy]83-valancy met]1109-the people valancy met]1108-most of the people valancy met looked at [her]83-valancy seriously and passed [her]83-valancy with a cool nod . [Nobody]348-nobody stopped to speak to [her]83-valancy . [Valancy]83-valancy put on [her]83-valancy green dress when [she]83-valancy got [home]2135-home . Then [she]83-valancy took it off again . [She]83-valancy felt so miserably undressed in its low neck and short sleeves . And that low , crimson girdle around the hips seemed positively indecent . [She]83-valancy hung it up in the closet , feeling flatly that [she]83-valancy had wasted [her]83-valancy money . [She]83-valancy would never have the courage to wear that dress . [John Foster]106-john foster ’s arraignment of fear had no power to stiffen [her]83-valancy against this . In this one thing habit and custom were still all - powerful . Yet [she]83-valancy sighed as [she]83-valancy went down to meet [Barney Snaith]132-barney in [her]83-valancy old snuff - brown silk . That green thing had been very becoming — [she]83-valancy had seen so much in [her]83-valancy one ashamed glance . Above it [her]83-valancy eyes had looked like odd brown jewels and the girdle had given [her]83-valancy flat figure an entirely different appearance . [She]83-valancy wished [she]83-valancy could have left it on . But there were some things [John Foster]106-john foster did not know . Every Sunday evening [Valancy]83-valancy went to [the little Free Methodist church]1112-the little free methodist church in [a valley on the edge of “ up [back”—a[1116-the minister who preached there] spireless little grey building among [the pines]1114-the pines]2512-back”—a spireless little grey building among the pines , with a few sunken graves and mossy gravestones in [the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside [it]1112-the little free methodist church]1115-the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside it]1113-a valley on the edge of “ up back”—a spireless little grey building among the pines , with a few sunken graves and mossy gravestones in the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside it . [She]83-valancy liked [the minister who preached [there]370-there]1116-the minister who preached there . [He]1116-the minister who preached there was so simple and sincere . [An old man , who lived in [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence]1118-an old man , who lived in port lawrence and came out by [the lake]1119-the lake in [a little disappearing propeller boat]1120-a little disappearing propeller boat to give a free service to [the people of [the small , stony farms back of [the hills]1123-the hills]1122-the small , stony farms back of the hills , who would otherwise never have heard any gospel message]1121-the people of the small , stony farms back of the hills , who would otherwise never have heard any gospel message . [She]83-valancy liked the simple service and the fervent singing . [She]83-valancy liked to sit by the open window and look out into [the pine woods]1124-the pine woods . [The congregation]1125-the congregation was always small . [The Free Methodists]1126-the free methodists were few in number , poor and generally illiterate . But [Valancy]83-valancy loved those Sunday evenings . For the first time in [her]83-valancy life [she]83-valancy liked going to [church]472-church . The rumour reached [Deerwood]86-the stirlings that [she]83-valancy had “ turned Free Methodist ”[83-valancy] and sent [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick to bed for a day . But [Valancy]83-valancy had not turned anything . [She]83-valancy went to [the church]2112-the church because [she]83-valancy liked it and because in some inexplicable way it did [her]83-valancy good . [Old Mr. Towers]219-mr. towers believed exactly what [he]219-mr. towers preached and somehow it made a tremendous difference . [They]1130-we did . [Valancy]83-valancy could not quite explain , even to [herself]83-valancy , just why [she]83-valancy wanted to go to that party . It was a dance “ up back ”[83-valancy] at [Chidley Corners]39-chidley corners ; and dances at [Chidley Corners]39-chidley corners were not , as a rule , the sort of assemblies where well - brought - up [young ladies]2099-young ladies were found . [She]83-valancy knew nothing at all of what dances at [Chidley Corners]39-chidley corners were apt to be like . [Her]83-valancy idea of dances had been fashioned on the correct affairs that went by that name in [Deerwood]10-deerwood and [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence . [Andtheyhad]221-andtheyhad never made [her]83-valancy look like this . If [she]83-valancy only had a necklace or something . [She]83-valancy would n’t feel so bare then . [She]83-valancy ran down to [the garden]989-the garden . There were clovers there — great crimson things growing in the long grass . [They]1139-they went early , for it was twelve miles to [Chidley Corners]39-chidley corners , and [they]1139-they had to go in [[Abel]133-roaring abel ’s old , ragged top - buggy]1140-abel ’s old , ragged top - buggy . [The road]2189-the road was rough and rocky , like [most Muskoka roads]1142-most muskoka roads , but full of the austere charm of [northern woods]1143-northern woods . [It]2189-the road wound through beautiful , purring pines that were ranks of enchantment in the June sunset , and over [the curious jade - green rivers of [Muskoka]12-muskoka]1144-the curious jade - green rivers of muskoka , fringed by aspens that were always quivering with some supernal joy . [The “ up back ”[1152-the “ up back ” girls] girls]1152-the “ up back ” girls were pretty and prettily dressed . [Valancy]83-valancy thought it the nicest party [she]83-valancy had ever attended . By eleven o’clock [she]83-valancy had changed [her]83-valancy mind . [A new crowd]1153-a new crowd had arrived — [a crowd unmistakably drunk]1154-a crowd unmistakably drunk . Whiskey began to circulate freely . Very soon almost all [the men]1155-the men were partly drunk . Those in [the porch]905-the porch and outside around the door began howling “ come - all - ye ’s ”[1157-them] and continued to howl [them]1157-them . [The room]443-the room grew noisy and reeking . Quarrels started up here and there . Bad language and obscene songs were heard . [The girls]2195-the girls , swung rudely in the dances , became dishevelled and tawdry . [Valancy]83-valancy , alone in [her]83-valancy corner , was feeling disgusted and repentant . Why had [she]83-valancy ever come to such a place ? Freedom and independence were all very well , but [one]330-one should not be [a little fool]1161-a little fool . [She]83-valancy might have known what it would be like — [she]83-valancy might have taken warning from [Cissy]172-cissy ’s guarded sentences . [Her]83-valancy head was aching — [she]83-valancy was sick of the whole thing . But what could [she]83-valancy do ? [She]83-valancy must stay to the end . [Abel]133-roaring abel could not leave till then . And that would probably be not till three or four in the morning . The new influx of [boys]2279-boys had left [the girls]2195-the girls far in the minority and [partners]1164-partners were scarce . [Valancy]83-valancy was pestered with invitations to dance . [She]83-valancy refused [them]1165-them all shortly , and some of [her]83-valancy refusals were not well taken . There were muttered oaths and sullen looks . Across [the room]443-the room [she]83-valancy saw [a group of [the strangers]1168-the strangers]1167-a group of the strangers talking together and glancing meaningly at [her]83-valancy . What were [they]1167-a group of the strangers plotting ? It was at this moment that [she]83-valancy saw [Barney Snaith]132-barney looking in over the heads of [the crowd at the doorway]1169-the crowd at the doorway . [Valancy]83-valancy had two distinct convictions — one was that [she]83-valancy was quite safe now ; the other was thatthiswas why [she]83-valancy had wanted to come to the dance . It had been such an absurd hope that [she]83-valancy had not recognised it before , but now [she]83-valancy knew [she]83-valancy had come because of the possibility that [Barney]132-barney might be [there]370-there , too . [She]83-valancy thought that perhaps [she]83-valancy ought to be ashamed for this , but [she]83-valancy was n’t . After [her]83-valancy feeling of relief [her]83-valancy next feeling was one of annoyance with [Barney]132-barney for coming [there]370-there unshaved . Surely [he]1172-he might have enough self - respect to groom [himself]1172-he up decently when [he]1172-he went to a party . There [he]1172-he was , bareheaded , bristly - chinned , in [his]1172-he old trousers and [his]1172-he blue homespun shirt . Not even a coat . [Valancy]83-valancy could have shaken [him]1172-he in [her]83-valancy anger . No wonder [people]434-people believed everything bad of [him]1172-he . But [she]83-valancy was not afraid any longer . One of [the whispering group]1174-the whispering group left [[his]1172-he comrades]1175-his comrades and came across [the room]443-the room to [her]83-valancy , through the whirling couples that now filled [it]443-the room uncomfortably . [He]1172-he was [a tall , broad - shouldered fellow , not ill - dressed or ill - looking but unmistakably half drunk]1177-a tall , broad - shouldered fellow , not ill - dressed or ill - looking but unmistakably half drunk . [He]1172-he asked [Valancy]83-valancy to dance . [Valancy]83-valancy declined civilly . [His]1172-he face turned livid . [He]1172-he threw [his]1172-he arm about [her]83-valancy and pulled [her]83-valancy to [him]1172-he . [His]1172-he hot , whiskied breath burned [her]83-valancy face . “ [We]2523-us wo n’t have fine - lady airs here , [[my]1172-he girl]2524-my girl . If [you]83-valancy ai n’t too good to come here [you]83-valancy ai n’t too good to dance with [us]2523-us . [Me]1172-he and [[my]1172-he pals]2525-my pals have been watching [you]83-valancy . [You]83-valancy ’ve got to give [us]2523-us each a turn and a kiss to boot . ”[1172-he] [Valancy]83-valancy tried desperately and vainly to free [herself]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy was being dragged out into the maze of [shouting , stamping , yelling dancers]1178-shouting , stamping , yelling dancers . The next moment [the man who held [her]83-valancy]1179-the man who held her went staggering across [the room]443-the room from a neatly planted blow on the jaw , knocking down [whirling couples]1181-whirling couples as [he]1179-the man who held her went . [Valancy]83-valancy felt [her]83-valancy arm grasped . “ This way — quick , ”[132-barney] said [Barney Snaith]132-barney . [He]1179-the man who held her swung [her]83-valancy out through the open window behind [them]1182-them , vaulted lightly over the sill and caught [her]83-valancy hand . “ Quick — [we]1182-them must run for it — they’ll be after [us]1182-them . ”[1179-the man who held her] [Valancy]83-valancy ran as [she]83-valancy had never run before , clinging tight to [Barney]132-barney ’s hand , wondering why [she]83-valancy did not drop dead in such a mad scamper . Suppose [she]83-valancy did ! What a scandal it would make for [[her]83-valancy poor people]1183-her poor people . For the first time [Valancy]83-valancy felt a little sorry for [them]1183-her poor people . Also , [she]83-valancy felt glad that [she]83-valancy had escaped from that horrible row . [Her]83-valancy feelings were badly mixed and [she]83-valancy had never had so many in such a brief time in [her]83-valancy life . [They]1182-them finally reached [a quiet corner in [the pine woods]1124-the pine woods]1184-a quiet corner in the pine woods . The pursuit had taken a different direction and the whoops and yells behind [them]1182-them were growing faint . [Valancy]83-valancy , out of breath , with a crazily beating heart , collapsed on the trunk of a fallen pine . “ Thanks , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy gasped . “ What a goose [you]83-valancy were to come to [such a place]2526-such a place ! ”[132-barney] said [Barney]132-barney . “ [I]83-valancy — didn’t — know — it — would — be like this , ”[83-valancy] protested [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [Youshouldhave]2527-youshouldhave known . [They]1205-they sat in silence for a long while . [Little rabbits]224-little rabbits hopped across [the road]2189-the road . Once or twice [an owl]1207-an owl laughed out delightfully . [The road]2189-the road beyond [them]1205-they was fringed with the woven shadow lace of trees . Away off to the southwest the sky was full of silvery little cirrus clouds above the spot where [[Barney]132-barney ’s island]1209-barney ’s island must be . [Valancy]83-valancy was perfectly happy . Some things dawn on [you]1210-you slowly . Some things come by lightning flashes . [Valancy]83-valancy had had a lightning flash . [She]83-valancy knew quite well now that [she]83-valancy loved [Barney]132-barney . Yesterday [she]83-valancy had been all [her]83-valancy own . Now [she]83-valancy was [this man]1087-this man ’s . Yet [he]1087-this man had done nothing — said nothing . [He]1087-this man had not even looked at [her]83-valancy as [a woman]414-a woman . But that did n’t matter . Nor did it matter what [he]1087-this man was or what [he]1087-this man had done . [She]83-valancy loved [him]1087-this man without any reservations . Everything in [her]83-valancy went out wholly to [him]1087-this man . [She]83-valancy had no wish to stifle or disown [her]83-valancy love . [She]83-valancy seemed to be [his]1087-this man so absolutely that thought apart from [him]1087-this man — thought in which [he]1087-this man did not predominate — was an impossibility . [She]83-valancy had realised , quite simply and fully , that [she]83-valancy loved [him]1087-this man , in the moment when [he]1087-this man was leaning on the car door , explaining that [Lady Jane]204-lady jane had no gas . [She]83-valancy had looked deep into [his]1087-this man eyes in the moonlight and had known . In just that infinitesimal space of time everything was changed . Old things passed away and all things became new . [She]83-valancy was no longer unimportant , little , [old maid Valancy Stirling]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy was [a woman , full of love and therefore rich and significant]1213-a woman , full of love and therefore rich and significant — justified to [herself]83-valancy . Life was no longer empty and futile , and death could cheat [her]83-valancy of nothing . Love had cast out [her]83-valancy last fear . Love ! What a searing , torturing , intolerably sweet thing it was — this possession of body , soul and mind ! With something at its core as fine and remote and purely spiritual as the tiny blue spark in the heart of the unbreakable diamond . No dream had ever been like this . [She]83-valancy was no longer solitary . [She]83-valancy was one of a vast sisterhood — [all the women who had ever loved in [the world]422-the world]1214-all the women who had ever loved in the world . [Barney]132-barney need never know it — though [she]83-valancy would not in the least have minded [his]1087-this man knowing . Butsheknew it and it made a tremendous difference to [her]83-valancy . Just to love ! [She]83-valancy did not ask to be loved . It was rapture enough just to sit there beside [him]1087-this man in silence , alone in the summer night in the white splendour of moonshine , with the wind blowing down on [them]1216-them out of [the pine woods]1124-the pine woods . [She]83-valancy had always envied the wind . So free . Blowing where it listed . Through [the hills]1123-the hills . Over [the lakes]1219-the lakes . What a tang , what a zip it had ! What a magic of adventure ! [Valancy]83-valancy felt as if [she]83-valancy had exchanged [her]83-valancy shop - worn soul for a fresh one , fire - new from the workshop of [the gods]1220-the gods . As far back as [she]83-valancy could look , life had been dull — colourless — savourless . Now [she]83-valancy had come to a little patch of violets , purple and fragrant — hers for the plucking . No matter who or what had been in [Barney]132-barney ’s past — no matter who or what might be in [his]1087-this man future — [no one else]2114-no one else could ever have this perfect hour . [The Port Lawrence Prices]232-the port lawrence prices were not accustomed to ally [themselves]232-the port lawrence prices with [families whose members]1239-families whose members “ worked out . ”[83-valancy] [Valancy]83-valancy could not resist temptation . [She]83-valancy leaned forward . “ [Olive]93-olive , does it hurt ? ”[83-valancy] [Olive]93-olive bit — stiffly . “ Doeswhathurt ? ”[83-valancy] “ Looking like that . ”[83-valancy] For a moment [Olive]93-olive resolved [she]93-olive would take no further notice of [Valancy]83-valancy . Then duty came uppermost . [She]93-olive must not miss the opportunity . “ [Doss]217-doss , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy implored , leaning forward also , “ wo n’t [you]217-doss come [home]2135-home — come [home]2135-home tonight ? ”[83-valancy] [Valancy]83-valancy yawned . “ [You]217-doss sound like a revival meeting , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy said . “ [You]217-doss really do . ”[83-valancy] “ If [you]217-doss will come back — — ”[83-valancy] “ All will be forgiven . ”[83-valancy] “ Yes , ”[93-olive] said [Olive]93-olive eagerly . On one of [Cissy]172-cissy ’s wakeful nights , [she]89-cousin stickles told [Valancy]83-valancy [her]89-cousin stickles poor little story . [They]1262-they were sitting by the open window . [She]83-valancy fell asleep when it was over , still holding to [Valancy]83-valancy ’s hand . [Valancy]83-valancy sat there in the silence . [She]83-valancy was not frightened — or even sorry . And , smiling , [she]172-cissy died . [Valancy]83-valancy crossed [Cissy]172-cissy ’s hands on [her]83-valancy breast and went to the open window . In the eastern sky , amid the fires of sunrise , an old moon was hanging — as slender and lovely as a new moon . [Valancy]83-valancy had never seen an old , old moon before . [She]83-valancy watched it pale and fade until it paled and faded out of sight in the living rose of day . [A little pool in [the barrens]1009-the barrens]1270-a little pool in the barrens shone in the sunrise like a great golden lily . But [nobody]348-nobody could ever hurt [her]83-valancy again . [Valancy]83-valancy had always thought death dreadful . But [Cissy]172-cissy had died so quietly — so pleasantly . [Death]236-death , [the miracle worker]1297-the miracle worker , suddenly made the thing quite respectable . If [Valancy]83-valancy would return to [home]2135-home and decency while public opinion was under its influence all might yet be well . [Society]237-society was suddenly forgetting all [Cecilia]172-cissy ’s wicked doings and remembering what a pretty , modest little thing [she]172-cissy had been—“and motherless , [you]2600-you know — motherless ! ”[99-uncle james] It was the psychological moment — said [Uncle James]99-uncle james . This was not — could not be — [the girl who had sat all night in [the woods]427-the woods with [Barney Snaith]132-barney — who had gone tearing bareheaded through [Deerwood]10-deerwood and [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence]1306-the girl who had sat all night in the woods with barney snaith — who had gone tearing bareheaded through deerwood and port lawrence . This was the Valancy [they]877-her family knew . Really , surprisingly capable and efficient . Perhaps [she]83-valancy had always been kept down a bit too much — [Amelia]154-amelia really was rather strict — hadn’t had a chance to show what was in [her]83-valancy . So thought [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings . And [Edward Beck]127-edward beck , from [the Port road]1308-the port road , a widower with [a large family who was beginning to take notice]1309-a large family who was beginning to take notice , took notice of [Valancy]83-valancy and thought [she]83-valancy might make [a mighty fine second wife]1310-a mighty fine second wife . [No beauty]1311-no beauty — but [a fifty - year - old widower]1312-a fifty - year - old widower , [Mr. Beck]239-mr. beck told [himself]239-mr. beck very reasonably , could n’t expect everything . Altogether , it seemed that [Valancy]83-valancy ’s matrimonial chances were never so bright as [they]877-her family were at [Cecilia Gay]172-cissy ’s funeral . What [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings and [Edward Beck]127-edward beck would have thought had [they]877-her family known the back of [Valancy]83-valancy ’s mind must be left to the imagination . [Valancy]83-valancy was hating the funeral — hating [the people who came to stare with curiosity at [Cecilia]172-cissy ’s marble - white face]1313-the people who came to stare with curiosity at cecilia ’s marble - white face — hating the smugness — hating the dragging , melancholy singing — hating [Mr. Bradly]235-mr. bradly ’s cautious platitudes . If [she]83-valancy could have had [her]83-valancy absurd way , there would have been no funeral at all . [She]83-valancy would have covered [Cissy]172-cissy over with flowers , shut [her]172-cissy away from prying eyes , and buried [her]172-cissy beside [[her]83-valancy nameless little baby]1314-her nameless little baby in [the grassy burying - ground under the pines of [the “ up back ”[83-valancy] church]1316-the “ up back ” church]1315-the grassy burying - ground under the pines of the “ up back ” church , with a bit of kindly prayer from [the old Free Methodist minister]1317-the old free methodist minister . [She]83-valancy remembered [Cissy]172-cissy saying once , “ [I]172-cissy wish [I]172-cissy could be buried deep in [the heart of [the woods]427-the woods]2602-the heart of the woods where [nobody]348-nobody would ever come to say , ‘ [Cissy Gay]172-cissy is buried here , ’ and tell over [my]172-cissy miserable story . ”[172-cissy] But this ! However , it would soon be over . [Valancy]83-valancy knew , if [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings and [Edward Beck]127-edward beck did n’t , exactly what [she]83-valancy intended to do then . [She]83-valancy had lain awake all the preceding night thinking about it and finally deciding on it . On the evening of the day after the funeral [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel went off for a spree . [He]133-roaring abel had been sober for four whole days and could endure it no longer . Before [he]133-roaring abel went , [Valancy]83-valancy told [him]133-roaring abel [she]83-valancy would be going away the next day . [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel was sorry , and said so .
