[A house without a spare - room]1455-a house without a spare - room was monstrous to [her]83-valancy . “ But it ’s a lovely spread , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy , with a kiss , “ and [I]83-valancy ’m so glad to have it . [I]83-valancy ’ll put it on [my]83-valancy own bed . [Barney]132-barney ’s old patch - work quilt is getting ragged . ”[83-valancy] “ [I]102-cousin georgiana do n’t see how [you]83-valancy can be contented to live up back , ”[102-cousin georgiana] sighed [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana . “ It ’s so out of [the world]422-the world . ”[102-cousin georgiana] “ Contented ! ”[83-valancy] [Valancy]83-valancy laughed . What was the use of trying to explain to [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana . “ It is , ”[102-cousin georgiana] [she]102-cousin georgiana agreed , “ most gloriously and entirely out of [the world]422-the world . ”[102-cousin georgiana] “ And [you]83-valancy are really happy , [dear]2074-dear ? ”[102-cousin georgiana] asked [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana wistfully . “ [I]83-valancy really am , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy gravely , [her]83-valancy eyes dancing . “ Marriage is such a serious thing , ”[102-cousin georgiana] sighed [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana . “ When it ’s going to last long , ”[83-valancy] agreed [Valancy]83-valancy . [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana did not understand this at all . But it worried [her]102-cousin georgiana and [she]102-cousin georgiana lay awake at nights wondering what [Valancy]83-valancy meant by it . [Valancy]83-valancy loved [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle and was completely satisfied with it . [The big living - room]1457-the big living - room had three windows , all commanding exquisite views of [exquisite Mistawis]22-mistawis . The one in the end of [the room]443-the room was an oriel window — which [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray , [Barney]132-barney explained , had got out of [some little , old “ up back ”[132-barney] church that had been sold]1459-some little , old “ up back ” church that had been sold . [It]1457-the big living - room faced the west and when the sunsets flooded [it]1457-the big living - room [Valancy]83-valancy ’s whole being knelt in prayer as if in [some great cathedral]1460-some great cathedral . [The new moons]1461-the new moons always looked down through it , the lower pine boughs swayed about the top of it , and all through the nights the soft , dim silver of [the lake]1119-the lake dreamed through it . There was a stone fireplace on the other side . No desecrating gas imitation but [a real fireplace where [you]1464-you could burn real logs]1463-a real fireplace where you could burn real logs . With a big grizzly bearskin on the floor before it , and beside [it]1457-the big living - room a hideous , red - plush sofa of [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray ’s régime . But [its]1457-the big living - room ugliness was hidden by silver - grey timber wolf skins , and [Valancy]83-valancy ’s cushions made [it]1457-the big living - room gay and comfortable . In a corner a nice , tall , lazy old clock ticked — the right kind of a clock . One that did not hurry the hours away but ticked them off deliberately . It was the jolliest looking old clock . A fat , corpulent clock with [a great , round , man]1465-a great , round , man ’s face painted on it , the hands stretching out of [its]1457-the big living - room nose and the hours encircling it like a halo . There was a big glass case of stuffed owls and several deer heads — likewise of [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray ’s vintage . Some comfortable old chairs that asked to be sat upon . A squat little chair with a cushion was prescriptively [Banjo]245-banjo ’s . If [anybody else]1466-anybody else dared sit on it [Banjo]245-banjo glared [him]245-banjo out of it with [his]245-banjo topaz - hued , black - ringed eyes . [Banjo]245-banjo had an adorable habit of hanging over the back of it , trying to catch [his]245-banjo own tail . Losing [his]245-banjo temper because [he]245-banjo could n’t catch it . Giving it a fierce bite for spite when hedidcatch it . Yowling malignantly with pain . [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy]83-valancy laughed at [him]245-banjo until [they]1467-they ached . But it was Good Luck [they]1468-they loved . [They]1468-they were both agreed that [Good Luck]246-good luck was so lovable that [he]245-banjo practically amounted to an obsession . One side of the wall was lined with rough , homemade book - shelves filled with books , and between the two side windows hung an old mirror in a faded gilt frame , with fat cupids gamboling in the panel over the glass . A mirror , [Valancy]83-valancy thought , that must be like the fabled mirror into which [Venus]266-venus had once looked and which thereafter reflected as beautiful [every woman who looked into it]1469-every woman who looked into it . [Valancy]83-valancy thought [she]83-valancy was almost pretty in that mirror . But that may have been because [she]83-valancy had shingled [her]83-valancy hair . This was before the day of bobs and was regarded as a wild , unheard - of proceeding — unless [you]1470-you had typhoid . When [Mrs. Frederick]91-mrs. frederick heard of it [she]91-mrs. frederick almost decided to erase [Valancy]83-valancy ’s name from the family Bible . [Barney]132-barney cut the hair , square off at the back of [Valancy]83-valancy ’s neck , bringing it down in a short black fringe over [her]83-valancy forehead . It gave a meaning and a purpose to [her]83-valancy little , three - cornered face that it never had possessed before . Even [her]83-valancy nose ceased to irritate [her]83-valancy . [Her]83-valancy eyes were bright , and [her]83-valancy sallow skin had cleared to the hue of creamy ivory . The old family joke had come true — [she]83-valancy was really fat at last — anyway , no longer skinny . [Valancy]83-valancy might never be beautiful , but [she]83-valancy was of the type that looks its best in [the woods]427-the woods — elfin — mocking — alluring . [Her]83-valancy heart bothered [her]83-valancy very little . When an attack threatened [she]83-valancy was generally able to head it off with [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent ’s prescription . The only bad one [she]83-valancy had was one night when [she]83-valancy was temporarily out of medicine . And itwasa bad one . For the time being , [Valancy]83-valancy realised keenly that death was actually waiting to pounce on [her]83-valancy any moment . But the rest of the time [she]83-valancy would not — did not — let [herself]83-valancy remember it at all .

[Valancy]83-valancy toiled not , neither did [she]83-valancy spin . There was really very little work to do . [She]83-valancy cooked [their]1472-them meals on a coal - oil stove , performing all [her]83-valancy little domestic rites carefully and exultingly , and [they]1472-them ate out on [the verandah]638-the verandah that almost overhung [the lake]1119-the lake . Before [them]1472-them lay [Mistawis]22-mistawis , like a scene out of some fairy tale of old time . And [Barney]132-barney smiling [his]1475-his twisted , enigmatical smile at [her]83-valancy across the table . “ What a view [old Tom]243-tom macmurray picked out when [he]243-tom macmurray built [this shack]2778-this shack ! ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney would say exultantly . Supper was the meal [Valancy]83-valancy liked best . The faint laughter of winds was always about [them]1472-them and the colours of [Mistawis]22-mistawis , imperial and spiritual , under the changing clouds were something that can not be expressed in mere words . Shadows , too . Clustering in the pines until a wind shook [them]1472-them out and pursued [them]1472-them over [Mistawis]22-mistawis . [They]1472-them lay all day along [the shores , threaded by ferns and wild blossoms]1476-the shores , threaded by ferns and wild blossoms . [They]1472-them stole around [the headlands]1477-the headlands in the glow of the sunset , until twilight wove [them]1472-them all into one great web of dusk . The cats , with [their]1472-them wise , innocent little faces , would sit on the verandah railing and eat the tidbits [Barney]132-barney flung [them]1472-them . And how good everything tasted ! [Valancy]83-valancy , amid all the romance of [Mistawis]22-mistawis , never forgot that [men]397-men had stomachs . [Barney]132-barney paid [her]83-valancy no end of compliments on [her]83-valancy cooking . “ After all , ”[1479-i] [he]1479-i admitted , “ there ’s something to be said for square meals . [I]1479-i ’ve mostly got along by boiling two or three dozen eggs hard at once and eating a few when [I]1479-i got hungry , with a slice of bacon once in a while and a jorum of tea . ”[1479-i] [Valancy]83-valancy poured tea out of [Barney]132-barney ’s little battered old pewter teapot of incredible age . [She]83-valancy had not even a set of dishes — only [Barney]132-barney ’s mismatched chipped bits — and a dear , big , pobby old jug of robin’s - egg blue . After the meal was over [they]1480-they would sit there and talk for hours — or sit and say nothing , in all the languages of [the world]422-the world , [Barney]132-barney pulling away at [his]1479-i pipe , [Valancy]83-valancy dreaming idly and deliciously , gazing at [the far - off hills beyond [Mistawis]22-mistawis]1482-the far - off hills beyond mistawis where the spires of firs came out against the sunset . The moonlight would begin to silver [the Mistawis]22-mistawis dusk . [Bats]268-bats would begin to swoop darkly against the pale , western gold . [The little waterfall that came down on [the high bank not far away]1484-the high bank not far away]1483-the little waterfall that came down on the high bank not far away would , by some whim of [the wildwood gods]1485-the wildwood gods , begin to look like [a wonderful white woman beckoning through the spicy , fragrant evergreens]1486-a wonderful white woman beckoning through the spicy , fragrant evergreens . And [Leander]248-leander would begin to chuckle diabolically on [the mainland shore]1487-the mainland shore . How sweet it was to sit there and do nothing in the beautiful silence , with [Barney]132-barney at the other side of the table , smoking ! There were [plenty of other islands in sight]1488-plenty of other islands in sight , though none were near enough to be troublesome as neighbours . There was [one little group of islets far off to the west which [they]1480-they called [the Fortunate Isles]51-the fortunate isles]1489-one little group of islets far off to the west which they called the fortunate isles . At sunrise they looked like a cluster of emeralds , at sunset like a cluster of amethysts . [They]1490-they were too small for [houses]1491-houses ; but the lights on [the larger islands]1492-the larger islands would bloom out all over [the lake]1119-the lake , and bonfires would be lighted on [their]1490-they shores , streaming up into the wood shadows and throwing great , blood - red ribbons over [the waters]1494-the waters . Music would drift to [them]1490-they alluringly from boats here and there , or from the verandahs on [the big house of [the millionaire on [the biggest island]1497-the biggest island]1496-the millionaire on the biggest island]1495-the big house of the millionaire on the biggest island . “ Would [you]83-valancy like [a house like that]2267-a house like that , [Moonlight]269-moonlight ? ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney asked once , waving [his]1498-his hand at it . [He]1498-his had taken to calling [her]1499-her Moonlight , and [Valancy]83-valancy loved it . “ No , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy , who had once dreamed of [a mountain castle ten times the size of [[the rich man]1501-the rich man ’s “ cottage]2780-the rich man ’s “ cottage ”[83-valancy] and now pitied [the poor inhabitants of [palaces]1503-palaces]1502-the poor inhabitants of palaces]1500-a mountain castle ten times the size of the rich man ’s “ cottage ” and now pitied the poor inhabitants of palaces . “ No . [It]2267-a house like that ’s too elegant . [I]83-valancy would have to carry it with [me]83-valancy everywhere [I]83-valancy went . On [my]83-valancy back like a snail . [It]2267-a house like that would own [me]83-valancy — possess [me]83-valancy , body and soul . [I]83-valancy like [a house [I]83-valancy can love and cuddle and [boss]2782-boss]2781-a house i can love and cuddle and boss . Just like [ours]2783-ours here . [I]83-valancy do n’t envy [Hamilton Gossard]270-hamilton gossard ‘ [the finest summer residence in [Canada]7-canada]2784-the finest summer residence in canada . ’ [It]270-hamilton gossard is magnificent , but [it]270-hamilton gossard is n’t [[my]83-valancy Blue Castle]2415-my blue castle . ”[83-valancy] Away down at [the far end of [the lake]1119-the lake]1504-the far end of the lake [they]1506-they got every night a glimpse of [a big , continental train]1507-a big , continental train rushing through [a clearing]1508-a clearing . [Valancy]83-valancy liked to watch [its]1507-a big , continental train lighted windows flash by and wonder who was on it and what hopes and fears it carried . [She]83-valancy also amused [herself]83-valancy by picturing [Barney]132-barney and [herself]83-valancy going to the dances and dinners in [the houses on [the islands]1510-the islands]1509-the houses on the islands , but [she]83-valancy did not want to go in reality . Once [they]1506-they did go to a masquerade dance in [the pavilion at [one of the hotels up [the lake]1119-the lake]1512-one of the hotels up the lake]1511-the pavilion at one of the hotels up the lake , and had a glorious evening , but slipped away in [[their]1506-they canoe]1514-their canoe , before unmasking time , back to [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle . “ It was lovely — but [I]83-valancy do n’t want to go again , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . So many hours a day [Barney]132-barney shut [himself]132-barney up in [[Bluebeard]244-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2664-bluebeard ’s chamber . [Valancy]83-valancy never saw the inside of it . From the smells that filtered through at times [she]83-valancy concluded [he]1517-he must be conducting chemical experiments — or counterfeiting money . [Valancy]83-valancy supposed there must be smelly processes in making counterfeit money . But [she]83-valancy did not trouble [herself]83-valancy about it . [She]83-valancy had no desire to peer into [the locked chambers of [Barney]132-barney ’s house of life]1518-the locked chambers of barney ’s house of life . [His]1517-he past and [his]1517-he future concerned [her]83-valancy not . Only this rapturous present . Nothing else mattered . Once [he]1517-he went away and stayed away two days and nights . [He]1517-he had asked [Valancy]83-valancy if [she]83-valancy would be afraid to stay alone and [she]83-valancy had said [she]83-valancy would not . [He]1517-he never told [her]83-valancy where [he]1517-he had been . [She]83-valancy was not afraid to be alone , but [she]83-valancy was horribly lonely . The sweetest sound [she]83-valancy had ever heard was [Lady Jane]204-lady jane ’s clatter through [the woods]427-the woods when [Barney]132-barney returned . And then [his]1517-he signal whistle from [the shore]2583-the shore . [She]83-valancy ran down to [the landing rock]1521-the landing rock to greet [him]1517-he — to nestle [herself]83-valancy into [his]1517-he eager arms — theydidseem eager . “ Have [you]83-valancy missed [me]132-barney , [Moonlight]269-moonlight ? ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney was whispering . “ It seems a hundred years since [you]1517-he went away , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [I]83-valancy wo n’t leave [you]1517-he again . ”[83-valancy] “ [You]83-valancy must , ”[83-valancy] protested [Valancy]83-valancy , “ if [you]83-valancy want to . [I]132-barney ’d be miserable if [I]132-barney thought [you]83-valancy wanted to go and did n’t , because of [me]132-barney . [I]132-barney want [you]83-valancy to feel perfectly free . ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney laughed — a little cynically . “ There is no such thing as freedom on [earth]2553-earth , ”[1517-he] [he]1517-he said . “ Only different kinds of bondages . And comparative bondages . Youthink [you]83-valancy are free now because [you]83-valancy ’ve escaped from a peculiarly unbearable kind of bondage . But are [you]83-valancy ? [You]83-valancy love [me]1517-he — that’sa bondage . ”[1517-he] “ Who said or wrote that ‘ [the prison unto which [we]1522-we doom [ourselves]1522-we no prison]2787-the prison unto which we doom ourselves no prison is ’ ? ”[83-valancy] asked [Valancy]83-valancy dreamily , clinging to [his]1517-he arm as [they]1522-we climbed up the rock steps . “ Ah , now [you]83-valancy have it , ”[132-barney] said [Barney]132-barney . “ That ’s all the freedom [we]1522-we can hope for — the freedom to choose [[our]1522-we prison]2788-our prison . But , [Moonlight,”—he]271-moonlight,”—he[132-barney] stopped at the door of [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle and looked about [him]1517-he — at [the glorious lake]1524-the glorious lake , [the great , shadowy woods]1525-the great , shadowy woods , the bonfires , the twinkling lights—“Moonlight , [I]132-barney ’m glad to be [home]2135-home again . When [I]132-barney came down through [the woods]427-the woods and saw [[my]132-barney home]2791-my home lights — [mine]132-barney — gleaming out under the old pines — something [I]132-barney ’d never seen before — oh , [girl]2792-girl , [I]132-barney was glad — glad ! ”[132-barney] But in spite of [Barney]132-barney ’s doctrine of bondage , [Valancy]83-valancy thought [they]1526-they were splendidly free . It was amazing to be able to sit up half the night and look at the moon if [you]1527-you wanted to . To be late for meals if [you]1527-you wanted to — [she]1528-she who had always been rebuked so sharply by [[her]1528-she mother]343-her mother and so reproachfully by [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles if [she]1528-she were one minute late . Dawdle over meals as long as [you]1527-you wanted to . Leave [your]1527-you crusts if [you]1527-you wanted to . Not come [home]2135-home at all for meals if [you]1527-you wanted to . Sit on [a sun - warm rock]1531-a sun - warm rock and paddle [your]1527-you bare feet in the hot sand if [you]1527-you wanted to . Just sit and do nothing in the beautiful silence if [you]1527-you wanted to . In short , do any fool thing [you]1527-you wanted to whenever the notion took [you]1527-you . Ifthatwasn’t freedom , what was ?

[They]1526-they did n’t spend all [their]1526-they days on [the island]2689-the island . [They]1526-they spent more than half of [them]1526-they wandering at will through [the enchanted Muskoka country]1533-the enchanted muskoka country . [Barney]132-barney knew [the woods]427-the woods as a book and [he]1535-he taught [their]1526-they lore and craft to [Valancy]83-valancy . [He]1535-he could always find trail and haunt of [the shy wood people]1536-the shy wood people . [Valancy]83-valancy learned the different fairy - likenesses of the mosses — the charm and exquisiteness of woodland blossoms . [She]83-valancy learned to know every bird at sight and mimic its call — though never so perfectly as [Barney]132-barney . [She]83-valancy made [friends]2077-friends with every kind of tree . [She]83-valancy learned to paddle [a canoe]1369-a canoe as well as [Barney]132-barney [himself]132-barney . [She]83-valancy liked to be out in the rain and [she]83-valancy never caught cold . Sometimes [they]1526-they took a lunch with [them]1526-they and went berrying — strawberries and blueberries . How pretty blueberries were — the dainty green of the unripe berries , the glossy pinks and scarlets of the half ripes , the misty blue of the fully matured ! And [Valancy]83-valancy learned the real flavour of the strawberry in its highest perfection . There was a certain sunlit dell on [the banks of [Mistawis]22-mistawis]1539-the banks of mistawis along which white birches grew on one side and on the other still , changeless ranks of young spruces . There were long grasses at the roots of the birches , combed down by the winds and wet with morning dew late into the afternoons . Here [they]1526-they found berries that might have graced the banquets of [Lucullus]272-lucullus , great ambrosial sweetnesses hanging like rubies to long , rosy stalks . [They]1526-they lifted [them]1540-them by the stalk and ate them from it , uncrushed and virgin , tasting each berry by itself with all its wild fragrance ensphered therein . When [Valancy]83-valancy carried any of these berries home that elusive essence escaped and they became nothing more than the common berries of [the market - place]1541-the market - place — very kitchenly good indeed , but not as they would have been , eaten in [[their]1526-they birch dell]1542-their birch dell until [her]83-valancy fingers were stained as pink as [Aurora]273-aurora ’s eyelids . Or [they]1526-they went after water - lilies . [Barney]132-barney knew where to find them in [the creeks and [bays of Mistawis]22-mistawis]1543-the creeks and bays of mistawis . Then [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle was glorious with [them]1526-they , every receptacle that [Valancy]83-valancy could contrive filled with the exquisite things . [If not water lilies]1545-if not water lilies then cardinal flowers , fresh and vivid from [the swamps of [Mistawis]22-mistawis]1546-the swamps of mistawis , where they burned like ribbons of flame . Sometimes [they]1526-they went trouting on [little nameless rivers]1547-little nameless rivers or [hidden brooks on whose banks Naiads might have sunned [their]1526-they white , wet limbs]1548-hidden brooks on whose banks naiads might have sunned their white , wet limbs . Then all [they]1526-they took with [them]1526-they were some raw potatoes and salt . [They]1526-they roasted the potatoes over a fire and [Barney]132-barney showed [Valancy]83-valancy how to cook the trout by wrapping them in leaves , coating them with mud and baking them in a bed of hot coals . Never were such delicious meals . [Valancy]83-valancy had such an appetite it was no wonder [she]83-valancy put flesh on [her]83-valancy bones . Or [they]1526-they just prowled and explored through [woods that always seemed to be expecting something wonderful to happen]1549-woods that always seemed to be expecting something wonderful to happen . At least , that was the way [Valancy]83-valancy felt about [them]1526-they . Down [the next hollow]1550-the next hollow — over [the next hill]1551-the next hill — [you]1552-you would find it . “ [We]1526-they do n’t know where [we]1526-they ’re going , but is n’t it fun to go ? ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney used to say . Once or twice night overtook [them]1526-they , too far from [[their]1526-they Blue Castle]1553-their blue castle to get back . But [Barney]132-barney made [a fragrant bed of bracken and fir boughs]1554-a fragrant bed of bracken and fir boughs and [they]1526-they slept on [it]1554-a fragrant bed of bracken and fir boughs dreamlessly , under a ceiling of old spruces with moss hanging from [them]1526-they , while beyond [them]1526-they moonlight and the murmur of pines blended together so that [one]330-one could hardly tell which was light and which was sound . There were rainy days , of course , when [Muskoka]12-muskoka was [a wet green land]1556-a wet green land . Days when showers drifted across [Mistawis]22-mistawis like pale ghosts of rain and [they]1526-they never thought of staying in because of it . Days when it rained in right good earnest and [they]1526-they had to stay in . Then [Barney]132-barney shut [himself]132-barney up in [[Bluebeard]244-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2664-bluebeard ’s chamber and [Valancy]83-valancy read , or dreamed on the wolfskins with Good Luck purring beside [her]83-valancy and [Banjo]245-banjo watching [them]1526-they suspiciously from [his]245-banjo own peculiar chair . On Sunday evenings [they]1526-they paddled across to [a point of land]1558-a point of land and walked from there through [the woods]427-the woods to [the little Free Methodist church]1112-the little free methodist church . [One]330-one felt really too happy for Sunday . [Valancy]83-valancy had never really liked Sundays before . And always , Sundays and weekdays , [she]83-valancy was with [Barney]132-barney . Nothing else really mattered . And what [a companion]1562-a companion [he]1562-a companion was ! How understanding ! How jolly ! How — how [Barney]132-barney - like ! That summed it all up . [Valancy]83-valancy had taken some of [her]83-valancy two hundred dollars out of the bank and spent it in pretty clothes . [She]83-valancy had a little smoke - blue chiffon which [she]83-valancy always put on when [they]1526-they spent the evening at [home]2135-home — smoke - blue with touches of silver about it . It was after [she]83-valancy began wearing it that [Barney]132-barney began calling [her]83-valancy Moonlight . “ Moonlight and blue twilight — that is what [you]83-valancy look like in that dress . [I]132-barney like it . It belongs to [you]83-valancy . [You]83-valancy are n’t exactly pretty , but [you]83-valancy have some adorable beauty - spots . [Your]83-valancy eyes . And that little kissable dent just between [your]83-valancy collar bones . [You]83-valancy have the wrist and ankle of [an aristocrat]2793-an aristocrat . That little head of yours is beautifully shaped . And when [you]83-valancy look backward over [your]83-valancy shoulder [you]83-valancy ’re maddening — especially in twilight or moonlight . [An elf maiden]2794-an elf maiden . [A wood sprite]2795-a wood sprite . [You]83-valancy belong to [the woods]427-the woods , [Moonlight]269-moonlight — [you]83-valancy should never be out of them . In spite of [your]83-valancy ancestry , there is something wild and remote and untamed about [you]83-valancy . And [you]83-valancy have such a nice , sweet , throaty , summery voice . Such a nice voice for love - making . ”[132-barney] “ Shure an ’ ye’ve kissed [the Blarney Stone]274-the blarney stone , ”[83-valancy] scoffed [Valancy]83-valancy . But [she]83-valancy tasted these compliments for weeks . [She]83-valancy got a pale green bathing - suit , too — a garment which would have given [her]83-valancy clan [their]1564-their deaths if [they]1564-their had ever seen [her]83-valancy in it . [Barney]132-barney taught [her]83-valancy how to swim . Sometimes [she]83-valancy put [her]83-valancy bathing - dress on when [she]83-valancy got up and did n’t take it off until [she]83-valancy went to bed — running down to [the water]1565-the water for a plunge whenever [she]83-valancy felt like it and sprawling on the sun - warm rocks to dry . [She]83-valancy had forgotten all the old humiliating things that used to come up against [her]83-valancy in the night — the injustices and the disappointments . It was as if they had all happened to [some other person]1354-some other person — not to [her]83-valancy , [Valancy Snaith]83-valancy , who had always been happy . “ [I]83-valancy understand now what it means to be born again , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy told [Barney]132-barney . [Holmes]275-holmes speaks of grief “ staining backward ”[83-valancy] through the pages of life ; but [Valancy]83-valancy found [her]83-valancy happiness had stained backward likewise and flooded with rose - colour [her]83-valancy whole previous drab existence . [She]83-valancy found it hard to believe that [she]83-valancy had ever been lonely and unhappy and afraid . “ When death comes , [I]83-valancy shall have lived , ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [I]83-valancy shall have had [my]83-valancy hour . ”[83-valancy] And [her]83-valancy dust - pile ! One day [Valancy]83-valancy had heaped up the sand in [the little island cove]1567-the little island cove in a tremendous cone and stuck a gay little Union Jack on top of it . “ What are [you]83-valancy celebrating ? ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney wanted to know . “ [I]83-valancy ’m just exorcising [an old demon]2797-an old demon , ”[83-valancy] [Valancy]83-valancy told [him]1568-him .

Autumn came . Late September with cool nights . [They]1569-they had to forsake [the verandah]638-the verandah ; but [they]1569-they kindled a fire in the big fireplace and sat before it with jest and laughter . [They]1569-they left the doors open , and [Banjo]245-banjo and Good Luck came and went at pleasure . Sometimes [they]1569-they sat gravely on the bearskin rug between [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy]83-valancy ; sometimes [they]1569-they slunk off into the mystery of the chill night outside . The stars smouldered in the horizon mists through [the old oriel]1571-the old oriel . The haunting , persistent croon of the pine - trees filled the air . The little waves began to make soft , sobbing splashes on the rocks below [them]1569-they in the rising winds . [They]1569-they needed no light but the firelight that sometimes leaped up and revealed [them]1569-they — sometimes shrouded [them]1569-they in shadow . When the night wind rose higher [Barney]132-barney would shut the door and light a lamp and read to [her]83-valancy — poetry and essays and gorgeous , dim chronicles of ancient wars . [Barney]132-barney never would read novels : [he]1568-him vowed they bored [him]1568-him . But sometimes [she]83-valancy read them [herself]83-valancy , curled up on the wolf skins , laughing aloud in peace . For [Barney]132-barney was not one of [those aggravating people who can never hear [you]1573-you smiling audibly over something [you]1573-you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ What is the joke ? ”[1572-those aggravating people who can never hear you smiling audibly over something you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ what is the joke ? ” october — with a gorgeous pageant of color around mistawis , into which valancy plunged her soul] October — with a gorgeous pageant of color around [Mistawis]22-mistawis , into which [Valancy]83-valancy plunged [her]83-valancy soul]1572-those aggravating people who can never hear you smiling audibly over something you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ what is the joke ? ” october — with a gorgeous pageant of color around mistawis , into which valancy plunged her soul . Never had [she]83-valancy imagined anything so splendid . A great , tinted peace . Blue , wind - winnowed skies . Sunlight sleeping in [the glades of [that fairyland]1575-that fairyland]1574-the glades of that fairyland . Long dreamy purple days paddling idly in [their]1569-they canoe along shores and up [the rivers of crimson and gold]1576-the rivers of crimson and gold . [A sleepy , red hunter]1577-a sleepy , red hunter ’s moon . Enchanted tempests that stripped the leaves from the trees and heaped them along [the shores]1578-the shores . Flying shadows of clouds . What had [all the smug , opulent lands]1579-all the smug , opulent lands out front to compare with this ? November — with uncanny witchery in [its]1580-its changed trees . With murky red sunsets flaming in smoky crimson behind [the westering hills]1581-the westering hills . With dear days when [the austere woods]1582-the austere woods were beautiful and gracious in a dignified serenity of folded hands and closed eyes — days full of a fine , pale sunshine that sifted through the late , leafless gold of the juniper - trees and glimmered among [the grey beeches]1583-the grey beeches , lighting up evergreen banks of moss and washing the colonnades of the pines . Days with a high - sprung sky of flawless turquoise . Days when an exquisite melancholy seemed to hang over [the landscape]1011-the landscape and dream about [the lake]1119-the lake . But days , too , of the wild blackness of great autumn storms , followed by dank , wet , streaming nights when there was witch - laughter in the pines and fitful moans among the mainland trees . What cared [they]1569-they ? [Old Tom]243-tom macmurray had built [his]243-tom macmurray roof well , and [his]243-tom macmurray chimney drew . “ Warm fire — books — comfort — safety from storm — [our]2798-our cats on the rug . Moonlight , ”[132-barney] said [Barney]132-barney , “ would [you]2799-you be any happier now if [you]2799-you had a million dollars ? ”[132-barney] “ No — nor half so happy . [I]132-barney ’d be bored by conventions and obligations then . ”[132-barney] December . Early snows and Orion . The pale fires of [the Milky Way]54-the milky way . It was really winter now — wonderful , cold , starry winter . How [Valancy]83-valancy had always hated winter ! Dull , brief , uneventful days . Long , cold , companionless nights . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles with [her]89-cousin stickles back that had to be rubbed continually . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles making weird noises gargling [her]89-cousin stickles throat in the mornings . [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles whining over the price of coal . [[Her]89-cousin stickles mother]343-her mother , probing , questioning , ignoring . Endless colds and bronchitis — or the dread of it . [Redfern]132-barney ’s Liniment and [Purple Pills]320-purple pills . But now [she]343-her mother loved winter . Winter was beautiful “ up back”—almost[343-her mother] intolerably beautiful . Days of clear brilliance . Evenings that were like cups of glamour — the purest vintage of winter ’s wine . Nights with their fire of stars . Cold , exquisite winter sunrises . Lovely ferns of ice all over the windows of [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle . Moonlight on birches in a silver thaw . Ragged shadows on windy evenings — torn , twisted , fantastic shadows . Great silences , austere and searching . [Jewelled , barbaric hills]1588-jewelled , barbaric hills . The sun suddenly breaking through grey clouds over long , white [Mistawis]22-mistawis . Icy - grey twilights , broken by snow - squalls , when [[their]1589-their cosy living - room]1590-their cosy living - room , with [its]1590-their cosy living - room goblins of firelight and inscrutable cats seemed cosier than ever . Every hour brought a new revelation and wonder . [Barney]132-barney ran [Lady Jane]204-lady jane into [[Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel ’s barn]1591-roaring abel ’s barn and taught [Valancy]83-valancy how to snowshoe — [Valancy]83-valancy , who ought to be laid up with bronchitis . But [Valancy]83-valancy had not even a cold . Later on in the winter [Barney]132-barney had a terrible one and [Valancy]83-valancy nursed [him]1592-he through it with a dread of pneumonia in [her]83-valancy heart . But [Valancy]83-valancy ’s colds seemed to have gone where old moons go . Which was luck — for [she]343-her mother had n’t even [Redfern]132-barney ’s Liniment . [She]343-her mother had thoughtfully bought a bottle at [the Port]2146-the port and [Barney]132-barney had hurled it into [frozen Mistawis]22-mistawis with a scowl . “ Bring no more of that devilish stuff here , ”[1592-he] [he]1592-he had ordered briefly . It was the first and last time [he]1592-he had spoken harshly to [her]343-her mother . [They]1594-they went for long tramps through the exquisite reticence of [winter woods]1595-winter woods and the silver jungles of frosted trees , and found loveliness everywhere . At times [they]1594-they seemed to be walking through a spellbound world of crystal and pearl , so white and radiant were clearings and [lakes]1596-lakes and sky . The air was so crisp and clear that it was half intoxicating . Once [they]1594-they stood in a hesitation of ecstasy at the entrance of [a narrow path between ranks of birches]1597-a narrow path between ranks of birches . Every twig and spray was outlined in snow . The undergrowth along [its]1598-its sides was [a little fairy forest]1599-a little fairy forest cut out of marble . The shadows cast by the pale sunshine were fine and spiritual . “ Come away , ”[132-barney] said [Barney]132-barney , turning . “ [We]1594-they must not commit the desecration of tramping through there . ”[132-barney] One evening [they]1594-they came upon a snowdrift far back in [an old clearing which was in the exact likeness of [a beautiful woman]1601-a beautiful woman ’s profile]1600-an old clearing which was in the exact likeness of a beautiful woman ’s profile . Seen too close by , the resemblance was lost , as in the fairy - tale of [the Castle of [St. John]276-st. john]1602-the castle of st. john . Seen from behind , it was a shapeless oddity . But at just the right distance and angle the outline was so perfect that when [they]1594-they came suddenly upon it , gleaming out against the dark background of spruce in the glow of that winter sunset [they]1594-they both exclaimed in amazement . There was a low , noble brow , a straight , classic nose , lips and chin and cheek - curve modelled as if [some goddess of old time]1603-some goddess of old time had sat to the sculptor , and a breast of such cold , swelling purity as the very spirit of [the winter woods]1604-the winter woods might display . “ ‘ All the beauty that old [Greece]57-greece and [Rome]58-rome , sung painted , taught , ’ ”[132-barney] quoted [Barney]132-barney . “ And to think no human eyes save [ours]1594-they have seen or will see it , ”[132-barney] breathed [Valancy]83-valancy , who felt at times as if [she]83-valancy were living in a book by [John Foster]106-john foster . As [she]83-valancy looked around [her]83-valancy [she]83-valancy recalled some passages [she]83-valancy had marked in the new Foster book [Barney]132-barney had brought [her]83-valancy from [the Port]2146-the port — with an adjuration not to expecthimto read or listen to it . “ ‘ All the tintings of winter woods are extremely delicate and elusive , ’ ”[83-valancy] recalled [Valancy]83-valancy . “ ‘ When the brief afternoon wanes and the sun just touches the tops of [the hills]1123-the hills , there seems to be all over [the woods]427-the woods an abundance , not of colour , but of the spirit of colour . There is really nothing but pure white after all , but one has the impression of fairy - like blendings of rose and violet , opal and heliotrope on [the slopes]2802-the slopes — in the dingles and along the curves of [the forest - land]2803-the forest - land . [You]2804-you feel sure the tint is there , but when [you]2804-you look at it directly it is gone . From the corner of [your]2804-you eye [you]2804-you are aware that it is lurking over yonder in a spot where there was nothing but pale purity a moment ago . Only just when the sun is setting is there a fleeting moment of real colour . Then the redness streams out over the snow and incarnadines [the hills]1123-the hills and [rivers]2806-rivers and smites the crest of the pines with flame . Just a few minutes of transfiguration and revelation — and it is gone . ’ “[83-valancy] [I]0-i wonder if [John Foster]106-john foster ever spent a winter in [Mistawis]22-mistawis , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy . “[106-john foster] Not likely , ” scoffed [Barney]132-barney . “[106-john foster] [People who write tosh like that]1606-people who write tosh like that generally write it in [a warm house on [some smug city street]1608-some smug city street]1607-a warm house on some smug city street . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are too hard on [John Foster]106-john foster , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy severely . “[0-i] [No one]485-no one could have written that little paragraph [I]0-i read [you]0-i last night without having seen it first — [you]0-i know [he]106-john foster could n’t . ” “[106-john foster] [I]0-i did n’t listen to it , ” said [Barney]132-barney morosely . “[0-i] [You]0-i know [I]0-i told [you]0-i [I]0-i would n’t . ” “[0-i] Then [you]0-i ’ve got to listen to it now , ” persisted [Valancy]83-valancy . [She]83-valancy made [him]106-john foster stand still on [his]106-john foster snowshoes while [she]83-valancy repeated it . “[0-i] ‘ [She]1610-she is [a rare artist]1611-a rare artist , [this old Mother Nature , who works “ for the joy of working ”[1610-she] and not in any spirit of vain show]1612-this old mother nature , who works “ for the joy of working ” and not in any spirit of vain show . Today [the fir woods]1613-the fir woods are a symphony of greens and greys , so subtle that [you]0-i can not tell where one shade begins to be the other . Grey trunk , green bough , grey - green moss above the white , grey - shadowed floor . Yet [the old gypsy]1614-the old gypsy does n’t like unrelieved monotones . For a wonder [Valancy]83-valancy had learned , when [she]83-valancy was [a little schoolgirl]2810-a little schoolgirl , to skate on [the pond behind [the Deerwood school]2812-the deerwood school]2811-the pond behind the deerwood school . [She]83-valancy never had any skates of [her]83-valancy own , but [some of [the other girls]2447-the other girls]2813-some of the other girls had lent [her]83-valancy theirs and [she]83-valancy seemed to have a natural knack of it . [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin had once promised [her]83-valancy a pair of skates for Christmas , but when Christmas came [he]100-uncle benjamin had given [her]83-valancy rubbers instead . [She]83-valancy had never skated since [she]83-valancy grew up , but the old trick came back quickly , and glorious were the hours [she]83-valancy and [Barney]132-barney spent skimming over [the white lakes]2815-the white lakes and past [the dark islands]2816-the dark islands where [the summer cottages]2817-the summer cottages were closed and silent . Tonight [they]2818-they flew down [Mistawis]22-mistawis before the wind , in an exhilaration that crimsoned [Valancy]83-valancy ’s cheeks under [her]83-valancy white tam . And at the end was [[her]83-valancy dear little house]2819-her dear little house , on [the island of pines]2820-the island of pines , with a coating of snow on [its]2819-her dear little house roof , sparkling in the moonlight . [Its]2819-her dear little house windows glinted impishly at [her]83-valancy in the stay gleams . “[132-barney] Looks exactly like a picture - book , does n’t it ? ” said [Barney]132-barney . [They]2818-they had a lovely Christmas . No rush . No scramble . No niggling attempts to make ends meet . No wild effort to remember whether [she]83-valancy had n’t given the same kind of present to [the same person]2821-the same person two Christmases before — [no mob of last - minute shoppers]2822-no mob of last - minute shoppers — [no dreary family]2823-no dreary family “[132-barney] reunions ” where [she]83-valancy sat mute and unimportant — no attacks of “[132-barney] nerves . ” [They]2818-they decorated [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle with pine boughs , and [Valancy]83-valancy made delightful little tinsel stars and hung them up amid the greenery . [She]83-valancy cooked a dinner to which [Barney]132-barney did full justice , while [Good Luck]246-good luck and [Banjo]245-banjo picked the bones . “[132-barney] [A land that can produce a goose like that is [an admirable land]1617-an admirable land]1616-a land that can produce a goose like that is an admirable land , ” vowed [Barney]132-barney . “[132-barney] [Canada]7-canada forever ! ” And [they]2818-they drank to the Union Jack a bottle of dandelion wine that [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana had given [Valancy]83-valancy along with the bedspread . “[330-one] [One]330-one never knows , ” [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana had said solemnly , “[330-one] when [one]330-one may need a little stimulant . ” [Barney]132-barney had asked [Valancy]83-valancy what [she]83-valancy wanted for a Christmas present . “[330-one] Something frivolous and unnecessary , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy , who had got a pair of goloshes last Christmas and two long - sleeved , woolen undervests the year before . And so on back . To [her]83-valancy delight , [Barney]132-barney gave [her]83-valancy a necklace of pearl beads . [Valancy]83-valancy had wanted a string of milky pearl beads — like congealed moonshine — all [her]83-valancy life . And these were so pretty . All that worried [her]83-valancy was that they were really too good . They must have cost a great deal — fifteen dollars , at least . Could [Barney]132-barney afford that ? [She]83-valancy did n’t know a thing about [his]2825-him finances . [She]83-valancy had refused to let [him]2825-him buy any of [her]83-valancy clothes — [she]83-valancy had enough for that , [she]83-valancy told [him]2825-him , as long as [she]83-valancy would need clothes . In a round , black jar on the chimney - piece [Barney]132-barney put money for [their]2826-their household expenses — always enough . The jar was never empty , though [Valancy]83-valancy never caught [him]2825-him replenishing it . [He]2825-him could n’t have much , of course , and that necklace — but [Valancy]83-valancy tossed care aside . [She]83-valancy would wear it and enjoy it . It was the first pretty thing [she]83-valancy had ever had .[330-one]

New Year . The old , shabby , inglorious outlived calendar came down . [The new one]1620-the new one went up . January was a month of storms . It snowed for three weeks on end . The thermometer went miles below zero and stayed there . But , as [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy]83-valancy pointed out to [each other]1189-each other , there were no mosquitoes . And the roar and crackle of [their]1622-they big fire drowned the howls of the north wind . Good Luck and [Banjo]245-banjo waxed fat and developed resplendent coats of thick , silky fur . [Nip]278-nip and [Tuck]247-tuck had gone . “ But [they]1622-they ’ll come back in spring , ”[132-barney] promised [Barney]132-barney . There was no monotony . Sometimes [they]1622-they had dramatic little private spats that never even thought of becoming quarrels . Sometimes [Roaring Abel]133-roaring abel dropped in — for an evening or a whole day — with [his]133-roaring abel old tartan cap and [his]133-roaring abel long red beard coated with snow . [He]133-roaring abel generally brought [his]133-roaring abel fiddle and played for [them]1622-they , to the delight of [all except [Banjo]245-banjo , who would go temporarily insane and retreat under [Valancy]83-valancy ’s bed]1623-all except banjo , who would go temporarily insane and retreat under valancy ’s bed . Sometimes [Abel]133-roaring abel and [Barney]132-barney talked while [Valancy]83-valancy made candy for [them]1622-they ; sometimes [they]1622-they sat and smoked in silenceà laTennyson and [Carlyle]279-carlyle , until [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle reeked and [Valancy]83-valancy fled to the open . Sometimes [they]1622-they played checkers fiercely and silently the whole night through . Sometimes [they]1622-they all ate the russet apples [Abel]133-roaring abel had brought , while the jolly old clock ticked the delightful minutes away . “ A plate of apples , an open fire , and ‘ a jolly goode booke whereon to looke ’ are a fair substitute for heaven , ”[132-barney] vowed [Barney]132-barney . “ [Any one]2045-any one can have [the streets of gold]2828-the streets of gold . Let ’s have another whack at [Carman]280-carman . ”[132-barney] It was easier now for [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings to believe [Valancy]83-valancy of the dead . Not even dim rumours of [her]83-valancy having been over at [the Port]2146-the port came to trouble [them]1622-they , though [she]83-valancy and [Barney]132-barney used to skate [there]370-there occasionally to see a movie and eat hot dogs shamelessly at the corner stand afterwards . Presumably [none of [the Stirlings]86-the stirlings]2046-none of the stirlings ever thought about [her]83-valancy — except [Cousin Georgiana]102-cousin georgiana , who used to lie awake worrying about poor [Doss]98-doss . Did [she]102-cousin georgiana have enough to eat ? Was that dreadful creature good to [her]102-cousin georgiana ? Was [she]83-valancy warm enough at nights ? [Valancy]83-valancy was quite warm at nights . [She]83-valancy used to wake up and revel silently in the cosiness of those winter nights on [that little island in [the frozen lake]1629-the frozen lake]1628-that little island in the frozen lake . The nights of other winters had been so cold and long . [Valancy]83-valancy hated to wake up in [them]1630-them and think about the bleakness and emptiness of the day that had passed and the bleakness and emptiness of the day that would come . Now , [she]83-valancy almost counted that night lost on which [she]83-valancy did n’t wake up and lie awake for half an hour just being happy , while [Barney]132-barney ’s regular breathing went on beside [her]83-valancy , and through the open door the smouldering brands in the fireplace winked at [her]83-valancy in the gloom . It was very nice to feel a little Lucky cat jump up on [your]1631-your bed in the darkness and snuggle down at [your]1631-your feet , purring ; but [Banjo]245-banjo would be sitting dourly by [himself]245-banjo out in front of the fire like a brooding demon . At such moments [Banjo]245-banjo was anything but canny , but [Valancy]83-valancy loved [his]245-banjo uncanniness . The side of the bed had to be right against the window . There was no other place for it in [the tiny room]1632-the tiny room . [Valancy]83-valancy , lying there , could look out of the window , through the big pine boughs that actually touched it , away up [Mistawis]22-mistawis , white and lustrous as a pavement of pearl , or dark and terrible in the storm . Sometimes the pine boughs tapped against the panes with friendly signals . Sometimes [she]83-valancy heard the little hissing whisper of snow against them right at [her]83-valancy side . Some nights [the whole outer world]1633-the whole outer world seemed given over to the empery of silence ; then came nights when there would be a majestic sweep of wind in the pines ; nights of dear starlight when it whistled freakishly and joyously around [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle ; brooding nights before storm when it crept along the floor of [the lake]1119-the lake with a low , wailing cry of boding and mystery . [Valancy]83-valancy wasted many perfectly good sleeping hours in these delightful communings . But [she]83-valancy could sleep as long in the morning as [she]83-valancy wanted to . [Nobody]348-nobody cared . [Barney]132-barney cooked [his]1637-his own breakfast of bacon and eggs and then shut [himself]1637-his up in [[Bluebeard]244-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2664-bluebeard ’s chamber till supper time . Then [they]1639-they had an evening of reading and talk . [They]1639-they talked about everything in [this world]437-this world and a good many things in [other worlds]1641-other worlds . [They]1639-they laughed over [their]1639-they own jokes until [the Blue Castles]281-the blue castles re - echoed . “ Youdolaugh beautifully , ”[132-barney] [Barney]132-barney told [her]83-valancy once . “ It makes [me]132-barney want to laugh just to hear [you]83-valancy laugh . There ’s a trick about [your]83-valancy laugh — as if there were so much more fun back of it that [you]83-valancy would n’t let out . Did [you]132-barney laugh like that before [you]132-barney came to [Mistawis]22-mistawis , [Moonlight]269-moonlight ? ”[132-barney] “ [I]1642-he never laughed at all — really . [I]1642-he used to giggle foolishly when [I]1642-he felt [I]1642-he was expected to . But now — the laugh just comes . ”[1642-he] It struck [Valancy]83-valancy more than once that [Barney]132-barney [himself]132-barney laughed a great deal oftener than [he]1642-he used to and that [his]1642-he laugh had changed . It had become wholesome . [She]83-valancy rarely heard the little cynical note in it now . Could [a man]335-a man laugh like that who had crimes on [his]335-a man conscience ? Yet [Barneymusthave]282-barneymusthave done something . [Valancy]83-valancy had indifferently made up [her]83-valancy mind as to what [he]1642-he had done . [She]83-valancy concluded [he]1642-he was [a defaulting bank cashier]1644-a defaulting bank cashier . [She]83-valancy had found in one of [Barney]132-barney ’s books an old clipping cut from a [Montreal]2-montreal paper in which [a vanished , defaulting cashier]1645-a vanished , defaulting cashier was described . The description applied to [Barney]132-barney — as well as to [half a dozen other men]1646-half a dozen other men [Valancy]83-valancy knew — and from some casual remarks [he]1642-he had dropped from time to time [she]83-valancy concluded [he]1642-he knew [Montreal]2-montreal rather well . [Valancy]83-valancy had it all figured out in the back of [her]83-valancy mind . [Barney]132-barney had been in [a bank]1647-a bank . [He]1642-he was tempted to take some money to speculate — meaning , of course , to put it back . [He]1642-he had got in deeper and deeper , until [he]1642-he found there was nothing for it but flight . It had happened so to [scores of [men]397-men]1648-scores of men . [He]1642-he had , [Valancy]83-valancy was absolutely certain , never meant to do wrong . Of course , the name of [the man in the clipping]1650-the man in the clipping was [Bernard Craig]132-barney . But [Valancy]83-valancy had always thought [Snaith]83-valancy was an alias . Not that it mattered . [Valancy]83-valancy had only one unhappy night that winter . It came in late March when most of the snow had gone and [Nip]278-nip and [Tuck]247-tuck had returned . [Barney]132-barney had gone off in the afternoon for a long , woodland tramp , saying [he]1642-he would be back by dark if all went well . Soon after [he]1642-he had gone it had begun to snow . The wind rose and presently [Mistawis]22-mistawis was in the grip of one of the worst storms of the winter . It tore up [the lake]1119-the lake and struck at [the little house]517-the little house . [The dark angry woods on [the mainland]1366-the mainland]1653-the dark angry woods on the mainland scowled at [Valancy]83-valancy , menace in the toss of [their]1653-the dark angry woods on the mainland boughs , threats in [their]1653-the dark angry woods on the mainland windy gloom , terror in the roar of [their]1653-the dark angry woods on the mainland hearts . The trees on [the island]2689-the island crouched in fear . [Valancy]83-valancy spent the night huddled on the rug before the fire , [her]83-valancy face buried in [her]83-valancy hands , when [she]83-valancy was not vainly peering from the oriel in a futile effort to see through the furious smoke of wind and snow that had once been blue - [dimpled Mistawis]22-mistawis . Where was [Barney]132-barney ? Lost on [the merciless lakes]1656-the merciless lakes ? Sinking exhausted in [the drifts of [the pathless woods]1658-the pathless woods]1657-the drifts of the pathless woods ? [Valancy]83-valancy died a hundred deaths that night and paid in full for all the happiness of [[her]83-valancy Blue Castle]399-her blue castle . When morning came the storm broke and cleared ; the sun shone gloriously over [Mistawis]22-mistawis ; and at noon [Barney]132-barney came [home]2135-home . [Valancy]83-valancy saw [him]1661-him from [the oriel]1662-the oriel as [he]1661-him came around [a wooded point]1663-a wooded point , slender and black against [the glistening white world]1664-the glistening white world . [She]83-valancy did not run to meet [him]1661-him . Something happened to [her]83-valancy knees and [she]83-valancy dropped down on [Banjo]245-banjo ’s chair . [Luckily Banjo]245-banjo got out from under in time , [his]245-banjo whiskers bristling with indignation . [Barney]132-barney found [her]83-valancy there , [her]83-valancy head buried in [her]83-valancy hands . “ [Barney]132-barney , [I]83-valancy thought [you]132-barney were dead , ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy whispered . [Barney]132-barney hooted . “ After two years of [the Klondike]60-the klondike did [you]83-valancy think a baby storm like this could get [me]132-barney ? [I]132-barney spent the night in [that old lumber shanty over by [Muskoka]12-muskoka]2829-that old lumber shanty over by muskoka . A bit cold but snug enough . Little goose ! [Your]83-valancy eyes look like burnt holes in a blanket . Did [you]83-valancy sit up here all night worrying over [an old woodsman like [me]132-barney]2830-an old woodsman like me ? ”[132-barney] “ Yes , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . “ [I]83-valancy — couldn’t help it . The storm seemed so wild . [Anybody]2057-anybody might have been lost in it . When — [I]83-valancy saw [you]83-valancy — come round the point — there — something happened to [me]83-valancy . [I]83-valancy do n’t know what . It was as if [I]83-valancy had died and come back to life . [I]83-valancy ca n’t describe it any other way . ”[83-valancy]

[Spring]284-spring . [Mistawis]22-mistawis black and sullen for a week or two , then flaming in sapphire and turquoise , lilac and rose again , laughing through the oriel , caressing [its]22-mistawis amethyst islands , rippling under winds soft as silk . Frogs , little green wizards of [swamp and pool]1665-swamp and pool , singing everywhere in the long twilights and long into the nights ; islands fairy - like in a green haze ; the evanescent beauty of wild young trees in early leaf ; frost - like loveliness of the new foliage of juniper - trees ; [the woods]427-the woods putting on a fashion of spring flowers , dainty , spiritual things akin to the soul of [the wilderness]1667-the wilderness ; red mist on the maples ; willows decked out with glossy silver pussies ; all the forgotten violets of [Mistawis]22-mistawis blooming again ; lure of April moons . “ Think how many thousands of springs have been here on [Mistawis]22-mistawis — and all of them beautiful , ”[83-valancy] said [Valancy]83-valancy . “ Oh , [Barney]132-barney , look at that wild plum ! [I]83-valancy will — [I]83-valancy must quote from [John Foster]106-john foster . There ’s a passage in one of [his]106-john foster books — [I’ve]83-valancy re - read it a hundred times . [He]106-john foster must have written it before a tree just like that : “[83-valancy] ‘ Behold the young wild plum - tree which has adorned [herself]1668-herself after immemorial fashion in a wedding - veil of fine lace . The fingers of wood pixies must have woven it , for nothing like it ever came from an earthly loom . [I]0-i vow the tree is conscious of its loveliness . [It]1669-it is bridling before [our]1670-they very eyes — as if [its]1669-it beauty were not the most ephemeral thing in [the woods]427-the woods , as it is the rarest and most exceeding , for today it is and tomorrow it is not . Every south wind purring through the boughs will winnow away a shower of slender petals . But what matter ? Today it is queen of [the wild places]2083-the wild places and it is always today in [the woods]427-the woods . ’ ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sure [you]0-i feel much better since [you]0-i ’ve got that out of [your]0-i system , ” said [Barney]132-barney heartlessly . “[0-i] Here ’s a patch of dandelions , ” said [Valancy]83-valancy , unsubdued . “[0-i] Dandelions should n’t grow in [the woods]427-the woods , though . [They]1675-they have n’t any sense of the fitness of things at all . [They]1675-they are too cheerful and self - satisfied . [They]1675-they have n’t any of the mystery and reserve of the real wood - flowers . ” “[1675-they] In short , [they]1675-they ’ve no secrets , ” said [Barney]132-barney . “[1675-they] But wait a bit . [The woods]427-the woods will have their own way even with those obvious dandelions . In a little while all that obtrusive yellowness and complacency will be gone and [we]1670-they ’ll find here misty , phantom - like globes hovering over those long grasses in full harmony with the traditions of [the forest]2087-the forest . ” “[285-john fosterish] That sounds [John Fosterish]285-john fosterish , ” teased [Valancy]83-valancy . “[285-john fosterish] What have [I]0-i done that deserved a slam like that ? ” complained [Barney]132-barney . One of the earliest signs of spring was the renaissance of [Lady Jane]204-lady jane . [Barney]132-barney put [her]204-lady jane on roads that [no other car would look at]2832-no other car would look at , and [they]1670-they went through [Deerwood]10-deerwood in mud to the axles . [They]1670-they passed several [Stirlings]86-the stirlings , who groaned and reflected that now spring was come [they]1670-they would encounter [that shameless pair]2833-that shameless pair everywhere . [Valancy]83-valancy , prowling about [[Deerwood]10-deerwood shops]2834-deerwood shops , met [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin on [the street]507-the street ; but [he]100-uncle benjamin did not realise until [he]100-uncle benjamin had gone two blocks further on that [the girl in the scarlet - collared blanket coat , with cheeks reddened in the sharp April air and the fringe of black hair over laughing , slanted eyes]2836-the girl in the scarlet - collared blanket coat , with cheeks reddened in the sharp april air and the fringe of black hair over laughing , slanted eyes , was [Valancy]83-valancy . When [he]100-uncle benjamin did realise it , [Uncle Benjamin]100-uncle benjamin was indignant . What business had [Valancy]83-valancy to look like — like — like [a young girl]2288-a young girl ? The way of [the transgressor]2838-the transgressor was hard . Had to be . Scriptural and proper . Yet [Valancy]83-valancy ’s path could n’t be hard . [She]83-valancy would n’t look like that if it were . There was something wrong . It was almost enough to make [a man]335-a man turn modernist . [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy]83-valancy clanged on to [the Port]2146-the port , so that it was dark when [they]2841-they went through [Deerwood]10-deerwood again . At [[her]83-valancy old home [Valancy]83-valancy]2842-her old home valancy , seized with a sudden impulse , got out , opened the little gate and tiptoed around to the sitting - room window . There sat [[her]83-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]89-cousin stickles drearily , grimly knitting . Baffling and inhuman as ever . If [they]2841-they had looked the least bit lonesome [Valancy]83-valancy would have gone in . But [they]2841-they did not . [Valancy]83-valancy would not disturb [them]2841-they for worlds .[0-i]

[Valancy]83-valancy had two wonderful moments that spring . One day , coming [home]2135-home through [the woods]427-the woods , with [her]83-valancy arms full of trailing arbutus and creeping spruce , [she]83-valancy met [a man who [she]83-valancy knew must be [Allan Tierney]286-allan tierney]1680-a man who she knew must be allan tierney . [Allan Tierney]286-allan tierney , [the celebrated painter of beautiful women]1681-the celebrated painter of beautiful women . [He]286-allan tierney lived in [New York]61-new york in winter , but [he]286-allan tierney owned [an island cottage at [the northern end of [Mistawis]22-mistawis to which [he]286-allan tierney always came the minute the ice was out of [the lake]1119-the lake]1683-the northern end of mistawis to which he always came the minute the ice was out of the lake]1682-an island cottage at the northern end of mistawis to which he always came the minute the ice was out of the lake . [He]286-allan tierney was reputed to be [a lonely , eccentric man]1685-a lonely , eccentric man . [He]286-allan tierney never flattered [[his]286-allan tierney sitters]1686-his sitters . There was no need to , for [he]286-allan tierney would not paint [any one who required flattery]1687-any one who required flattery . To be painted by [Allan Tierney]286-allan tierney was all thecachetof beauty [a woman]414-a woman could desire . [Valancy]83-valancy had heard so much about [him]286-allan tierney that [she]83-valancy could n’t help turning [her]83-valancy head back over [her]83-valancy shoulder for another shy , curious look at [him]286-allan tierney . A shaft of pale spring sunlight fell through a great pine athwart [her]83-valancy bare black head and [her]83-valancy slanted eyes . [She]83-valancy wore a pale green sweater and had bound a fillet of linnæa vine about [her]83-valancy hair . The feathery fountain of trailing spruce overflowed [her]83-valancy arms and fell around [her]83-valancy . [Me]1689-she ! [Little - old - maid - Valancy]83-valancy - [Stirling]83-valancy - that - was . ”[1689-she] [Her]1689-she second wonder - moment came one evening in [May]288-may . [She]1689-she realised that [Barney]132-barney actually liked [her]1689-she . [She]1689-she had always hoped [he]1690-he did , but sometimes [she]1689-she had a little , disagreeable , haunting dread that [he]1690-he was just kind and nice and chummy out of pity ; knowing that [she]1689-she had n’t long to live and determined [she]1689-she should have a good time as long as [she]1689-she did live ; but away back in [his]1690-he mind rather looking forward to freedom again , with no intrusive woman creature in [his]1690-he island fastness and no chattering thing beside [him]1690-he in [his]1690-he woodland prowls . [She]1689-she knew [he]1690-he could never love [her]1689-she . [She]1689-she did not even want [him]1690-he to . If [he]1690-he loved [her]1689-she [he]1690-he would be unhappy when [she]1689-she died — [Valancy]83-valancy never flinched from the plain word . No “ passing away ”[1689-she] for [her]1689-she . And [she]1689-she did not want [him]1690-he to be the least unhappy . But neither did [she]1689-she want [him]1690-he to be glad — or relieved . [She]1689-she wanted [him]1690-he to like [her]1689-she and miss [her]1689-she as [a good chum]1691-a good chum . But [she]1689-she had never been sure until this night that [he]1690-he did . [They]1692-they had walked over [the hills]1123-the hills in the sunset . [They]1692-they had the delight of discovering a virgin spring in [a ferny hollow]1694-a ferny hollow and had drunk together from it out of a birch - bark cup ; [they]1692-they had come to an old tumble - down rail fence and sat on it for a long time . [They]1692-they did n’t talk much , but [Valancy]83-valancy had a curious sense ofoneness . [She]1689-she knew that [she]1689-she could n’t have felt that if [he]1690-he had n’t liked [her]1689-she . “ [You]1689-she nice little thing , ”[132-barney] said [Barney]132-barney suddenly . “ Oh , [you]1689-she nice little thing ! Sometimes [I]132-barney feel [you]1689-she ’re too nice to be real — that [I]132-barney ’m just dreaming [you]1689-she . ”[132-barney] “ Why ca n’t [I]83-valancy die now — this very minute — when [I]83-valancy am so happy ! ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy . Well , it could n’t be so very long now . Somehow , [Valancy]83-valancy had always felt [she]1689-she would live out the year [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent had allotted . [She]1689-she had not been careful — [she]1689-she had never tried to be . But , somehow , [she]1689-she had always counted on living out [her]1689-she year . [She]1689-she had not let [herself]1689-she think about it at all . But now , sitting here beside [Barney]132-barney , with [her]1689-she hand in [his]1695-his , a sudden realisation came to [her]1689-she . [She]1689-she had not had a heart attack for a long while — two months at least . The last one [she]1689-she had had was two or three nights before [Barney]132-barney was out in the storm . Since then [she]1689-she had not remembered [she]1689-she had a heart . Well , no doubt , it betokened the nearness of the end . [Nature]289-nature had given up the struggle . There would be no more pain . “ [I]83-valancy ’m afraid [heaven]2392-heaven will be very dull after this past year , ”[83-valancy] thought [Valancy]83-valancy . “ But perhaps [one]330-one will not remember . Would that be — nice ? No , no . [I]83-valancy do n’t want to forget [Barney]132-barney . [I]83-valancy ’d rather be miserable in [heaven]2392-heaven remembering [him]2864-him than happy forgetting [him]2864-him . And [I]83-valancy ’ll always remember through all eternity — that [he]2864-him really , reallyliked [me]83-valancy . ”[83-valancy]

Thirty seconds can be very long sometimes . Long enough to work a miracle or a revolution . In thirty seconds life changed wholly for [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy Snaith]83-valancy . [They]1696-their had gone around [the lake]1119-the lake one June evening in [their]1696-their disappearing propeller , fished for an hour in [a little creek]1698-a little creek , left [[their]1696-their boat]1699-their boat there , and walked up through [the woods]427-the woods to [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence two miles away . [Valancy]83-valancy prowled a bit in [the shops]1701-the shops and got [herself]83-valancy a new pair of sensible shoes . [Her]83-valancy old pair had suddenly and completely given out , and this evening [she]83-valancy had been compelled to put on the little fancy pair of patent - leather with rather high , slender heels , which [she]83-valancy had bought in a fit of folly one day in the winter because of their beauty and because [she]83-valancy wanted to make one foolish , extravagant purchase in [her]83-valancy life . [She]83-valancy sometimes put them on of an evening in [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle , but this was the first time [she]83-valancy had worn them outside . [She]83-valancy had not found it any too easy walking up through [the woods]427-the woods in them , and [Barney]132-barney guyed [her]83-valancy unmercifully about them . But in spite of the inconvenience , [Valancy]83-valancy secretly rather liked the look of [her]83-valancy trim ankles and high instep above those pretty , foolish shoes and did not change them in the shop as [she]83-valancy might have done . The sun was hanging low above the pines when [they]1704-they left [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence . To the north of [it]1705-it [the woods]427-the woods closed around [the town]1258-the town quite suddenly . [Valancy]83-valancy always had a sense of stepping from [one world]1708-one world to another — from reality to [fairyland]1709-fairyland — when [she]83-valancy went out of [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence and in a twinkling found [it]1710-it shut off behind [her]83-valancy by [the armies of the pines]1711-the armies of the pines . A mile and a half from [Port Lawrence]9-port lawrence there was [a small railroad station]1712-a small railroad station with [a little station - house which at this hour of the day]1713-a little station - house which at this hour of the day was deserted , since [no local train]1714-no local train was due . [Not a soul]1715-not a soul was in sight when [Barney]132-barney and [Valancy]83-valancy emerged from [the woods]427-the woods . Off to the left a sudden curve in [the track]1717-the track hid [it]1710-it from view , but over the tree - tops beyond , the long plume of smoke betokened the approach of [a through train]1718-a through train . The rails were vibrating to its thunder as [Barney]132-barney stepped across the switch . [Valancy]83-valancy was a few steps behind [him]1719-his , loitering to gather June - bells along [the little , winding path]1720-the little , winding path . But there was plenty of time to get across before [the train]2149-the train came . [She]83-valancy stepped unconcernedly over the first rail . [She]83-valancy could never tell how it happened . The ensuing thirty seconds always seemed in [her]83-valancy recollection like a chaotic nightmare in which [she]83-valancy endured the agony of a thousand lifetimes . The heel of [her]83-valancy pretty , foolish shoe caught in a crevice of the switch . [She]83-valancy could not pull it loose . “ [Barney]132-barney — [Barney]132-barney ! ”[83-valancy] [she]83-valancy called in alarm . [Barney]132-barney turned — saw [her]83-valancy predicament — saw [her]83-valancy ashen face — dashed back . [He]1719-his tried to pull [her]83-valancy clear — [he]1719-his tried to wrench [her]83-valancy foot from the prisoning hold . In vain . In a moment [the train]2149-the train would sweep around [the curve]1723-the curve — would be on [them]1724-them . “ Go — go — quick — [you’ll]132-barney be killed , [Barney]132-barney ! ”[83-valancy] shrieked [Valancy]83-valancy , trying to push [him]1719-his away . [Barney]132-barney dropped on [his]1719-his knees , ghost - white , frantically tearing at [her]83-valancy shoe - lace . The knot defied [his]1719-his trembling fingers . [He]1719-his snatched a knife from [his]1719-his pocket and slashed at it . [Valancy]83-valancy still strove blindly to push [him]1719-his away . [Her]83-valancy mind was full of the hideous thought that [Barney]132-barney was going to be killed . [She]83-valancy had no thought for [her]83-valancy own danger . “ [Barney]132-barney — go — go — for [God]95-god ’s sake — go ! ”[1719-his] “ Never ! ”[132-barney] muttered [Barney]132-barney between [his]1719-his set teeth . [He]1719-his gave one mad wrench at the lace . As [the train]2149-the train thundered around [the curve]1723-the curve [he]1719-his sprang up and caught [Valancy]83-valancy — dragging [her]83-valancy clear , leaving the shoe behind [her]83-valancy . The wind from [the train]2149-the train as it swept by turned to icy cold the streaming perspiration on [his]1719-his face . “ Thank [God]95-god ! ”[1719-his] [he]1719-his breathed . Then [they]1728-they stumbled over to the little seat at the end of [the station - house]1731-the station - house and dropped on it . [Barney]132-barney buried [his]1719-his face in [his]1719-his hands and said not a word . [Valancy]83-valancy sat , staring straight ahead of [her]83-valancy with unseeing eyes at [the great pine woods]1732-the great pine woods , the stumps of [the clearing]1733-the clearing , the long , gleaming rails . There was only one thought in [her]83-valancy dazed mind — a thought that seemed to burn it as a shaving of fire might burn [her]83-valancy body . [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent had told [her]83-valancy over a year ago that [she]83-valancy had a serious form of heart - disease — that any excitement might be fatal . If that were so , why was [she]83-valancy not dead now ? This very minute ? [She]83-valancy had just experienced as much and as terrible excitement as [most people]1734-most people experience in a lifetime , crowded into that endless thirty seconds . Yet [she]83-valancy had not died of it . [She]83-valancy was not an iota the worse for it . [She]83-valancy looked at [Barney]132-barney , hunched up beside [her]83-valancy . [His]1737-he silence was very eloquent . Had the same thought occurred to [him]1737-he ? [He]1737-he had never paced like that before . And an hour ago — only an hour ago — [she]83-valancy had been so happy !

Finally [Valancy]83-valancy went to bed . Before [she]83-valancy went [she]83-valancy re - read [Dr. Trent]85-dr. trent ’s letter . It comforted [her]83-valancy a little . So positive . So assured . [Valancy]83-valancy , who had spent so many happy wakeful hours of night lying by that window , now paid the price of [them]1755-them all in this one night of misery . [She]83-valancy must write a note . [The imp]1818-the imp in the back of [her]83-valancy mind laughed . In every story [she]83-valancy had ever read when [a runaway wife]1848-a runaway wife decamped from [home]2135-home [she]1848-a runaway wife left a note , generally on the pin - cushion . It was not a very original idea . But [one]330-one had to leave something intelligible . What was there to do but write a note ? [She]83-valancy looked vaguely about [her]83-valancy for something to write with . Ink ? There was none . [Valancy]83-valancy had never written anything since [she]83-valancy had come to [the Blue Castle]325-the blue castle , save memoranda of household necessaries for [Barney]132-barney . A pencil sufficed for [them]1852-them , but now the pencil was not to be found . [Valancy]83-valancy absently crossed to the door of [[Bluebeard]244-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2664-bluebeard ’s chamber and tried it . [She]83-valancy vaguely expected to find it locked , but it opened unresistingly . [She]83-valancy had never tried it before , and did not know whether [Barney]132-barney habitually kept it locked or not . If [he]1854-he did , [he]1854-he must have been badly upset to leave it unlocked . [She]83-valancy did not realise that [she]83-valancy was doing something [he]1854-he had told [her]83-valancy not to do . [She]83-valancy was only looking for something to write with . All [her]83-valancy faculties were concentrated on deciding just what [she]83-valancy would say and how [she]83-valancy would say it . There was not the slightest curiosity in [her]83-valancy as [she]83-valancy went into [the lean - to]2663-the lean - to . There were [no beautiful women]1856-no beautiful women hanging by [their]1856-no beautiful women hair on the walls . [It]1857-it seemed [a very harmless apartment]1858-a very harmless apartment , with a commonplace little sheet - iron stove in the middle of [it]1857-it , [its]1857-it pipe sticking out through the roof . At one end was a table or counter crowded with odd - looking utensils . Used no doubt by [Barney]132-barney in [his]1854-he smelly operations . Chemical experiments , probably , [she]83-valancy reflected dully . At the other end was a big writing desk and swivel - chair . The side walls were lined with books . [Valancy]83-valancy went blindly to the desk . There [she]83-valancy stood motionless for a few minutes , looking down at something that lay on it . A bundle of galley - proofs . They strike their roots deep into the traditions of [an older world]2984-an older world , but wind and star love [their]1860-their lofty tops . [She]83-valancy had absorbed all the shocks and sensations that [she]83-valancy could compass for one day . This affected [her]83-valancy neither one way nor the other . [She]83-valancy only thought : “ So this explains it . ”[83-valancy] “ It ”[83-valancy] was a small matter that had , somehow , stuck in [her]83-valancy mind more persistently than its importance seemed to justify . [She]83-valancy took up [Barney]132-barney ’s pen — and a vile one it was — pulled a sheet of paper to [her]83-valancy and began to write . [Valancy]83-valancy looked dully about [[her]83-valancy old room]1901-her old room . [It]1901-her old room , too , was so exactly the same that it seemed almost impossible to believe in the changes that had come to [her]83-valancy since [she]83-valancy had last slept in [it]1901-her old room .
